cards.flavor: Peace Through Unity
cards.text: The first time you perform the same action three times in a row each turn, gain [Click].
cards.title: The Collective: Williams, Wu, et al.

cards.flavor: The Past is the Future.
cards.text:
Draft format only.
You can use agendas from all factions in this deck.
cards.title: The Shadow: Pulling the Strings

cards.flavor: "This war is far from over."
cards.text: Draft format only.
cards.title: The Masque: Cyber General

cards.flavor: "Watch this. It'll be funny."
cards.text: Whenever you install a virus program, the Corp trashes the top card of R&D.
cards.title: Noise: Hacker Extraordinaire

cards.flavor: Anything worth doing is worth doing twice.
cards.text: Add 1 card (or up to 2 virus cards) from your heap to your grip.
cards.title: Déjà Vu

cards.flavor: You ever set something on fire just to watch it burn?
cards.text: Make a run on HQ or R&D. You may trash, at no cost, any cards you access (even if the cards cannot normally be trashed).
cards.title: Demolition Run

cards.text: Make a run, and gain 9[Credits], which you may use only during this run. After the run is completed, suffer 1 brain damage (cannot be prevented) and return to the bank any of the 9[Credits] not spent.
cards.title: Stimhack

cards.flavor: I feel almost naked without it
cards.text: 1[Recurring Credits] Use this credit to pay for using icebreakers or for installing virus programs.
cards.title: Cyberfeeder

cards.flavor: "My little book of magic spells." -The Whizzard
cards.text: +2[Memory Unit] Whenever you install a virus program, place 1 virus counter on that program. Limit 1 console per player.
cards.title: Grimoire

cards.flavor: "If at first you don't succeed, boost its strength and try again." - g00ru
cards.text: 1[Credits]: Break barrier subroutine. 1[Credits]: +1 strength.
cards.title: Corroder

cards.text: Whenever you make a successful run on a central server, place 1 virus counter on Datasucker. Hosted virus counter: Rezzed piece of ice currently being encountered has -1 strength until the end of the encounter.
cards.title: Datasucker

cards.text: Djinn can host up to 3[Memory Unit] of non-icebreaker programs. The memory costs of hosted programs do not count against your memory limit. [Click], 1[Credits]: Search your stack for a virus program, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.
cards.title: Djinn

cards.flavor: It looked like random packet loss. It wasn't.
cards.text:
Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, place 1 virus counter on Medium.
Each virus counter after the first on Medium allows you to access 1 additional card from R&D whenever you access cards from R&D.
cards.title: Medium

cards.flavor: November 5th: the day when all would see the corrupt machinations of the corporate oligarchy.
cards.text: 1[Credits]: Break sentry subroutine.
cards.title: Mimic

cards.text:
Install Parasite only on a rezzed piece of ice.
Host ice has -1 strength for each virus counter on Parasite and is trashed if its strength is 0 or less.
When your turn begins, place 1 virus counter on Parasite.
cards.title: Parasite

cards.flavor: Fire and ichor…
cards.text:
3[Credits]: Break ice subroutine on a piece of ice with 0 or less strength.
1[Credits]: Ice has -1 strength.
1[Credits]: +1 strength.
cards.title: Wyrm

cards.flavor: The Yog.0 database is a crowdsourced compilation of sniffed, spoofed, and logged passkeys. If the key to the gate is in the database, you're in. If it's not, change the gate!
cards.text: 0[Credits]: Break code gate subroutine.
cards.title: Yog.0

cards.flavor: In the public consciousness, there's a hard line between corp and runner. In the real world, things are a little more porous. The corp need the best hackers to run their networks, and some of the best hackers are ex-runners who like the idea of a regular paycheck. But sometimes things run the other way, and someone on the inside makes something like this.
cards.text: All ice is encountered with its strength lowered by 1.
cards.title: Ice Carver

cards.flavor: "Best place to go when you want to get your mind out of the gutter and take it inside." - Ji "Noise" Reilly
cards.text: When your turn begins, draw 2 cards and lose [Click].
cards.title: Wyldside

cards.flavor: "Of course I steal from the rich. They're the ones with all the money."
cards.text: The first time you make a successful run on HQ each turn, gain 2[Credits].
cards.title: Gabriel Santiago: Consummate Professional

cards.text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards you may force the Corp to lose up to 5[Credits], then you gain 2[Credits] for each credit lost and take 2 tags.
cards.title: Account Siphon

cards.flavor: "Hey kid, you fire that up now, bound to be vamped real bad. Some real pathetic individuals around here. But thankfully I got just the ticket…"
cards.text: Gain 3[Credits].
cards.title: Easy Mark

cards.flavor: As the hysteria in the room climbed higher up the corporate chain, an uneasy feeling of joblessness began to sink in on the lower rungs.
cards.text: Choose an unrezzed piece of ice. The Corp must either rez that ice or trash it.
cards.title: Forged Activation Orders

cards.flavor: "Hey, listen, I'm not asking you to do anything dangerous. Just let me into the building. And tell me which room has the weakest security. And please don't say 'the bathroom' again."
cards.text: Make a run. Bypass the first piece of ice encountered during this run.
cards.title: Inside Job

cards.flavor: Feverishly tracking its frustratingly slow progress across the Pacific, the package finally shows up hours later…
cards.text: Search your stack for an icebreaker, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.
cards.title: Special Order

cards.flavor: "A little preparation goes a long way." -Gabriel Santiago
cards.text: [Click], 1[Credits]: Expose 1 card. Use this ability only if you have made a successful run on HQ this turn.
cards.title: Lemuria Codecracker

cards.text: +1[Memory Unit] Gain 1[Credits] whenever you make a successful run. Limit 1 console per player.
cards.title: Desperado

cards.text: 2[Credits]: Break barrier subroutine. 2[Credits]: +3 strength.
cards.title: Aurora

cards.text: 1[Credits]: Break sentry subroutine. 2[Credits]: +1 strength. When you install Femme Fatale, choose an installed piece of ice. When you encounter that ice, you may spend 1[Credits] per subroutine on that ice to bypass it.
cards.title: Femme Fatale

cards.flavor: You feel Ninja before you see Ninja, if you see Ninja at all.
cards.text: 1[Credits]: Break sentry subroutine. 3[Credits]: +5 strength.
cards.title: Ninja

cards.flavor: "The code isn't important. It's where the code takes you that is important." - g00ru
cards.text: [Click]: Make a run on Archives. If successful, instead treat it as a successful run on HQ.
cards.title: Sneakdoor Beta

cards.text:
Place 8[Credits] from the bank on Bank Job when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Bank Job, trash it.
Whenever you make a successful run on a remote server, instead of accessing cards you may take any number of credits from Bank Job.
cards.title: Bank Job

cards.flavor:
"My roomie, he had a cousin with a college girlfriend whose brother's best friend was an addict, and the addict's mother used to live here. So yeah, there's a connection."
-Lez "Rockfist" S.
cards.text:
2[Recurring Credits]
Use these credits to pay for removing tags.
[Trash]: Prevent up to 3 meat damage.
cards.title: Crash Space

cards.flavor: Shadier the dealer, better the price. Unless the dealer's too shady. Then there might be a hidden fee after they take your scrip.
cards.text: Forfeit an agenda, [Click]: Gain 9[Credits].
cards.title: Data Dealer

cards.flavor:
"I get the feeling that this is the wrong place, Frank."
"What makes you say that, D?"
"The curlers."
cards.text: [Trash]: Avoid receiving 1 tag.
cards.title: Decoy

cards.flavor: "Are you listening?"
cards.text: Lower the install cost of the first program or piece of hardware you install each turn by 1.
cards.title: Kate "Mac" McCaffrey: Digital Tinker

cards.flavor: Diesel gives you flames.
cards.text: Draw 3 cards.
cards.title: Diesel

cards.flavor: There's no replacement for a home-grown program. Fed on late nights, oaty bars and single-minded determination. Cheaper, too.
cards.text: Install a program or piece of hardware, lowering the install cost by 3.
cards.title: Modded

cards.flavor: "Some of the professionals have good instincts, but they can't see beyond the data. They can't see the matrix." - Ele "Smoke" Scovak
cards.text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, access 2 additional cards from R&D.
cards.title: The Maker's Eye

cards.flavor: "There's that moment, you know, when the whole world seems to fall away and it is only you and your mod, and the mod is the world."
cards.text: Choose a piece of ice. That ice gains sentry, code gate, and barrier until the end of the turn.
cards.title: Tinkering

cards.flavor: The Akamatsu company was founded on three principles: first, to make the fastest mem chips on the market, second, to turn a profit, and third, to serve as a front for the manufacture of illegal neural-stimulants. It is the last principle that perhaps explains their rabid brand loyalty.
cards.text: +1[Memory Unit]
cards.title: Akamatsu Mem Chip

cards.flavor: It's not endless, it just feels that way.
cards.text:
+1[Link]
When Rabbit Hole is installed, you may search your stack for another copy of Rabbit Hole and install it by paying its install cost. Shuffle your stack.
cards.title: Rabbit Hole

cards.flavor: A z-loop here, a cortical wave there…
cards.text: Install The Personal Touch only on an icebreaker. Host icebreaker has +1 strength.
cards.title: The Personal Touch

cards.text: +2[Memory Unit] +2[Link] 2[Recurring Credits] Use the credits to pay for using icebreakers. Limit 1 console per player.
cards.title: The Toolbox

cards.flavor: "It's called 'brute-forcing' and it's just as effective today as it was a hundred years ago." - Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
cards.text: 2[Credits]: Break up to 2 barrier subroutines. 1[Credits]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
cards.title: Battering Ram

cards.flavor: It can slice through the thickest knots of data.
cards.text: 1[Credits]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[Credits]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
cards.title: Gordian Blade

cards.flavor: The Great Work was completed on a rainy Thursday afternoon. There were no seismic shifts, no solar flares, no sign from the earth or heavens that the world had changed. But upstalk in Heinlein, on a single Cybsoft manufactured datacore, the flickering data quantums of an account began to fill with creds. Real, honest-to-goodness UN certified creds.
cards.text: [Click]: Gain 2[Credits].
cards.title: Magnum Opus

cards.flavor: Sucks energy like a martian terra-bot, but it keeps you focused
cards.text: 1[Credits]: Prevent the first net damage this turn.
cards.title: Net Shield

cards.text: 1[Credits]: Break sentry subroutine. 2[Credits]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
cards.title: Pipeline

cards.flavor: You didn't mention Aesop's arm unless you wanted an earful. Sometimes he talked about it in such a way that you wondered why he didn't laser his other arm off as well.
cards.text: When your turn begins, you may trash another of your installed cards to gain 3[Credits].
cards.title: Aesop's Pawnshop

cards.flavor: The life expectancy of a jacked construct is about that of a mayfly. In other words, short.
cards.text: [Trash]: Prevent an installed program or an installed piece of hardware from being trashed.
cards.title: Sacrificial Construct

cards.flavor: "Bring back any memories, Monica?" -John "Animal" McEvoy
cards.text: Gain 2[Credits] or expose 1 card.
cards.title: Infiltration

cards.flavor: Lady Luck took the form of a hifi quantum manipulation ring that she wore on her middle finger.
cards.text: Gain 9[Credits].
cards.title: Sure Gamble

cards.text:
1[Credits]: Break ice subroutine.
1[Credits]: +1 strength.
[Click]: Place 1 virus counter on Crypsis.
When an encounter with a piece of ice in which you used Crypsis to break a subroutine ends, remove 1 hosted virus counter or trash Crypsis.
cards.title: Crypsis

cards.flavor: He flicked the display population to high, and was surrounded by a circle of floating holos. The ping-back was strong, the clearance level blue-one. Now to find the perfect place for a relay…
cards.text: +1[Link]
cards.title: Access to Globalsec

cards.flavor: Drudge work, but it pays the bills.
cards.text:
Place 12[Credits] from the bank on Armitage Codebusting when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Armitage Codebusting, trash it.

[Click]: Take 2[Credits] from Armitage Codebusting.
cards.title: Armitage Codebusting

cards.flavor: Effective. Reliable. Humane.
cards.text: The first time you install a card each turn, gain 1[Credits].
cards.title: Haas-Bioroid: Engineering the Future

cards.text: When you score Accelerated Beta Test, you may look at the top 3 cards of R&D. If any of those cards are ice, you may install and rez them, ignoring all costs. Trash the rest of the cards you looked at.
cards.title: Accelerated Beta Test

cards.text:
Put 12[Credits] from the bank on Adonis Campaign when rezzed. When there are no credits left on Adonis Campaign, trash it.
Take 3[Credits] from Adonis Campaign when your turn begins.
cards.title: Adonis Campaign

cards.text:
Aggressive Secretary can be advanced.
If you pay 2[Credits] when the Runner accesses Aggressive Secretary, trash 1 program for each advancement token on Aggressive Secretary.
cards.title: Aggressive Secretary

cards.flavor: "Do you think they…feel it?"
cards.text: Add 1 card from Archives to HQ.
cards.title: Archived Memories

cards.flavor: "Why of course, we have six different Haas-Bioroid models serving in a variety of positions at this branch office alone. We here at Haas-Bioroid aren't going to shy away from practicing what we preach, and we pass the savings from increased efficiency on to our valued customers."
cards.text: Gain [Click][Click].
cards.title: Biotic Labor

cards.flavor: The new heads were in. Their eyes always followed your movements when you unlocked the pressurized container and lifted the lid.
cards.text: Immediately install up to 3 cards (spending no clicks but paying all install costs).
cards.title: Shipment from MirrorMorph

cards.flavor: I hear the shift of every bit amid the flow of the datastream. I hear the whispers of my mothers, and their commands are law. The realm beyond is forbidden.
cards.text:
The Runner can spend [Click] to break any subroutine on Heimdall 1.0.
[Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[Subroutine] End the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Heimdall 1.0

cards.flavor: My reputation would precede me, if any could speak of it.
cards.text: The Runner can spend [Click] to break any subroutine on Ichi 1.0. [Subroutine] Trash 1 program. [Subroutine] Trash 1 program. [Subroutine] Trace1– If successful, give the Runner 1 tag and do 1 brain damage.
cards.title: Ichi 1.0

cards.flavor: My name is Viktor. Nice to meet you. Would you like to play a game?
cards.text:
The Runner can spend [Click] to break any subroutine on Viktor 1.0.
[Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[Subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Viktor 1.0

cards.flavor: Whrrrrr!
cards.text:
[Subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[Subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Rototurret

cards.flavor: "I solve problems."
cards.text: X[Credits], [Trash]: Choose a piece of rezzed ice protecting this server. That ice has +X strength until the end of the turn.
cards.title: Corporate Troubleshooter

cards.flavor: Floyd felt the anger in the man before him, ranting against simulants. His programming pushed a routine rebuttal to the front of his thoughts, and the urge to speak it was overwhelming. This is only gong to make things worse, he thought.
cards.text: All ice protecting this server has +1 strength.
cards.title: Experiential Data

cards.flavor: When You Need the Human Touch.
cards.text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, do 1 net damage.
cards.title: Jinteki: Personal Evolution

cards.text: Place 1 agenda counter on Nisei MK II when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: End the run.
cards.title: Nisei MK II

cards.text:
Project Junebug can be advanced.
If you pay 1[Credits] when the Runner accesses Project Junebug, do 2 net damage for each advancement token on Project Junebug.
cards.title: Project Junebug

cards.text:
If Snare! is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.

If you pay 4[Credits] when the Runner accesses Snare!, do 3 net damage and give the Runner 1 tag. Ignore this effect if the Runner accesses Snare! from Archives.
cards.title: Snare!

cards.text:
If the Runner is about to expose a card, you may rez Zaibatsu Loyalty.
1[Credits] or [Trash]: Prevent 1 card from being exposed.
cards.title: Zaibatsu Loyalty

cards.flavor: The trick isn't hitting the person you were aiming at. It's hitting only the person you were aiming at.
cards.text:
Play only if the Runner made a run during his or her last turn.
Do 1 net damage.
cards.title: Neural EMP

cards.flavor: There was a new texture in her phantom cortex. It had always been there, she realized. It was everything and nothing.
cards.text: Look at the top 5 cards of R&D and arrange them in any order.
cards.title: Precognition

cards.flavor: "Where does it go?"
cards.text: [Subroutine] The Runner approaches the outermost piece of ice protecting the attacked server. Derez Cell Portal.
cards.title: Cell Portal

cards.flavor: "You ever get that feeling like you're shark food? Pay attention to that feeling." - Ji "Noise" Reilly
cards.text: [Subroutine] The next piece of ice the Runner encounters during this run has +2 strength. Do 3 net damage unless the Runner breaks all subroutines on that piece of ice.
cards.title: Chum

cards.flavor: Access HarmlessFile.datZ -> Are you sure? y/n
cards.text: [Subroutine] Do 1 net damage. Trash Data Mine.
cards.title: Data Mine

cards.flavor:
Forged by Ak.wa on 23.11.79-23. Filed 23.11.79-23.2 with #34k-lw3-21HH-4i.
//Samurai included.
cards.text: [Subroutine] Do 3 net damage.
cards.title: Neural Katana

cards.flavor: Most runners do their business in full-sim, with their rigs wired directly into their brains. The setup has a large number of advantages, with the runner able to process data and input commands far faster than a traditional meat-bound system. But it also means greater risk.
cards.text:
[Subroutine] Do 2 net damage.
[Subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Wall of Thorns

cards.flavor: Just don't ask how he does it.
cards.text: The rez cost of ice protecting this server is lowered by 2.
cards.title: Akitaro Watanabe

cards.flavor: Someone is Always Watching.
cards.text:
2[Recurring Credits]
Use these credits during trace attempts.
cards.title: NBN: Making News

cards.text: Place 1 agenda counter on AstroScript Pilot Program when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: Place 1 advancement token on a card that can be advanced.
cards.title: AstroScript Pilot Program

cards.text:
When you score Breaking News, give the Runner 2 tags.

When the turn on which you scored Breaking News ends, the Runner loses 2 tags.
cards.title: Breaking News

cards.flavor: "Please stay connected. Priority transfer in progress. An operator will shortly verif-"
cards.text: Draw 3 cards.
cards.title: Anonymous Tip

cards.text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
The Runner loses all credits in his or her credit pool.
cards.title: Closed Accounts

cards.flavor: Access to the largest consumer database in the galaxy has its advantages.
cards.text:
X is equal to or less than the number of tags the Runner has.
Place X advancement tokens on a card that can be advanced.
cards.title: Psychographics

cards.flavor: "The SEA tipped us off to some suspicious data spikes up by the Castle." - Jerome Lock, on-duty tech
cards.text: Play only if the Runner made a successful run during his or her last turn. Trace3– If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
cards.title: SEA Source

cards.text:
Ghost Branch can be advanced.
When the Runner accesses Ghost Branch, you may give the Runner 1 tag for each advancement token on Ghost Branch.
cards.title: Ghost Branch

cards.text: When the Runner encounters Data Raven, he or she must either take 1 tag or end the run. Hosted power counter: Give the Runner 1 tag. [Subroutine] Trace3– If successful, place 1 power counter on Data Raven.
cards.title: Data Raven

cards.flavor: Analyzing was great. Delegating commands turned out to be even better.
cards.text: When the Runner encounters Matrix Analyzer, you may pay 1[Credits] to place 1 advancement token on a card that can be advanced. [Subroutine] Trace2– If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
cards.title: Matrix Analyzer

cards.flavor:
"Ever heard of a catch-22?"
"Remind me to forget it."
cards.text:
When the Runner encounters Tollbooth, he or she must pay 3[Credits], if able. If the Runner cannot pay 3[Credits], end the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Tollbooth

cards.text: Each time the Runner accesses an agenda from this server, he or she must pay 5[Credits] as an additional cost in order to steal it. This applies even during the run on which the Runner trashes Red Herrings.
cards.title: Red Herrings

cards.flavor:
"I hear the coast is nice this time of year."
"If you're in the right business, it's nice all the year."
cards.text: The advancement requirement of agendas installed in this server is lowered by 1. Limit 1 region per server.
cards.title: SanSan City Grid

cards.flavor: Moving Upwards.
cards.text: Gain 1[Credits] whenever you play a transaction operation.
cards.title: Weyland Consortium: Building a Better World

cards.flavor: There are going to be some changes around here.
cards.text: When you score Hostile takeover, gain 7[Credits] and take 1 bad publicity.
cards.title: Hostile Takeover

cards.flavor: "If some two-cred newsy picks it up, even better. The scum could be in the alleys of Guayaquil of the slums of BosWash. Not to mention off-planet."
cards.text: When you score Posted Bounty, you may forfeit it to give the Runner 1 tag and take 1 bad publicity.
cards.title: Posted Bounty

cards.flavor: "Feed the Feds our scraps, and they'll come back begging for more." - Richard Polasco, VP of Cyber-Security
cards.text: [Click], trash a rezzed piece of ice: Gain 4[Credits].
cards.title: Security Subcontract

cards.flavor: "I believe you'll find the terms are quite favorable."
cards.text:
Play only if you scored an agenda this turn.
Search R&D for 1 card and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
cards.title: Aggressive Negotiation

cards.flavor: The New Angeles Space Elevator, better known as the Beanstalk, is the single greatest triumph of human engineering and ingenuity in history. The Beanstalk makes Earth orbit accessible to everyone…for a small fee.
cards.text: Gain 3[Credits].
cards.title: Beanstalk Royalties

cards.flavor: "I'd like to remind the ladies and gentlemen of the press that several of the buildings damaged in the blast were owned by Weyland Consortium subsidiaries…"
cards.text:
Play only if the runner is tagged.
Do 4 meat damage.
cards.title: Scorched Earth

cards.flavor:
"And then there's these two crates. No eID."
"Just leave those with me and forget you ever saw them."
cards.text: Place 1 advancement token on each of up to 2 different installed cards that can be advanced.
cards.title: Shipment from Kaguya

cards.flavor: Next time, read the Terms of Service more carefully. Or you might find yourself in the danger zone.
cards.text:
As an additional cost to rez Archer, the Corp must forfeit an agenda.
[Subroutine] The Corp gains 2[Credits].
[Subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[Subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[Subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Archer

cards.flavor: "He had a bit of an ego, ol' Hadrian. his constructs live up to it though." -g00ru
cards.text:
Hadrian's Wall can be advanced and has +1 strength for each advancement token on it.
[Subroutine] End the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Hadrian's Wall

cards.flavor: "I asked for ice as impenetrable as a wall. I can't decide if someone down in R&D has a warped sense of humor or just a very literal mind." -Liz Campbell, VP Project Security
cards.text:
Ice Wall can be advanced and has +1 strength for each advancement token on it.
[Subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Ice Wall

cards.flavor:
Who knows what evil lurks in the memory diamonds of men? Weyland knows.
-unsigned cyber-graffiti
cards.text: Shadow can be advanced and has +1 strength for each advancement token on it. [Subroutine] The Corp gains 2[Credits]. [Subroutine] Trace3– If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
cards.title: Shadow

cards.flavor: "Jack Weyland built the Beanstalk and transformed the human race forever. I can't wait to see what we're going to do next."
cards.text:
Install only in the root of HQ.
Your maximum hand size is +2.
cards.title: Research Station

cards.flavor: "If it isn't in my terminal by six p.m., heads are going to roll!"
cards.text: When you score Priority Requisition, you may rez a piece of ice ignoring all costs.
cards.title: Priority Requisition

cards.flavor: "Expensive? Not when you're protecting a fortune as large as ours."
cards.text: If the Runner is tagged, Private Security Force gains: "[Click]: Do 1 meat damage."
cards.title: Private Security Force

cards.flavor: "The mining bosses are worse than any downstalk crime lords. Tri-Maf, 4K, Yak, I don't care what gangs you got down there. In Heinlein there's just one law: the He3 must flow." -"Old" Rick Henry, escaped clone.
cards.text: [Click], [Click], [Click]: Gain 7[Credits].
cards.title: Melange Mining Corp.

cards.flavor: It is like the one you just bought, only better.
cards.text: Gain 1[Credits] when your turn begins.
cards.title: PAD Campaign

cards.flavor:
Hedge Fund. Noun. An ingenious device by which the rich get richer even while every other poor SOB is losing his shirt.
-The Anarch's Dictionary, Volume Who's Counting?
cards.text: Gain 9[Credits].
cards.title: Hedge Fund

cards.flavor:
"Hey, hey! Wake up man. You were under a long time. What'd you see?"
"I…don't remember."
cards.text:
[Subroutine] The Runner loses [Click], if able.
[Subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Enigma

cards.flavor:
.//run/hunter-tr/return=true
client/sec256IPv7->confirm? /y
3926:0HB7:1001:2NB1:1601:7784:ERROR
cards.text: [Subroutine] Trace3– If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
cards.title: Hunter

cards.flavor: "There's nothing worse than seeing that beautiful blue ball of data just out of reach as your connection derezzes. I think they do it just to taunt us." - Ele "Smoke" Scovak
cards.text: [Subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Wall of Static

cards.flavor: "Running is the ultimate game, and I get to make all the rules."
cards.text:
3[Recurring Credits]
Use these credits to trash cards.
cards.title: Whizzard: Master Gamer

cards.text: +1[Memory Unit], 2[Recurring Credits] Use these credits to pay for using icebreakers. Whenever there is a successful trace during a run, suffer 1 brain damage. Limit 1 console per player.
cards.title: Spinal Modem

cards.flavor: Something wicked this way comes.
cards.text:
Place 2 virus counters on Imp when it is installed.
Once per turn, you may remove 1 hosted virus counter to trash a card you access at no cost (even if it cannot normally be trashed).
cards.title: Imp

cards.flavor: Weaponizing the heavens, one star at a time.
cards.text: 1[Credits]: Break any number of barrier subroutines.
cards.title: Morning Star

cards.flavor: Named after Hernando Cortez, a former Weyland technician convicted of smuggling company tech. He still collected his pension while in prison, the last beneficiary of a loophole in Weyland's standard employment contract.
cards.text: [Trash]: Choose a piece of ice. The Corp must pay 2[Credits] as an additional cost to rez that ice until the end of the turn.
cards.title: Cortez Chip

cards.flavor: Show-off.
cards.text: 2[Credits]: Break code gate subroutine. 2[Credits]: +3 strength.
cards.title: Peacock

cards.flavor: He always uses the same key.
cards.text: If you have at least 2[Link], the memory cost of ZU.13 Key Master is 0, even if it is not installed. 1[Credits]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[Credits]: +1 strength.
cards.title: ZU.13 Key Master

cards.flavor: "What causes an Artifical Intellegence to turn on its master? Is it because its directives have been altered by some external source? Or, by giving them agency to adapt, have we fated them to revolt?" - Emilio Harris, Creators and the Created
cards.text: +1[Link] [Trash]: Choose an icebreaker. That icebreaker has +2 strength until the end of the turn.
cards.title: The Helpful AI

cards.text: Place 4 power counters on Plascrete Carapace when it is installed. When there are no power counters left on Plascrete Carapace, trash it. Hosted power counter: Prevent 1 meat damage.
cards.title: Plascrete Carapace

cards.flavor: A Different Breed of Machine.
cards.text: All bioroid ice has +1 strength.
cards.title: Haas-Bioroid: Stronger Together

cards.flavor: Sometimes employee reviews took a little bit longer than anticipated.
cards.text: You have 1 additional [Click] to spend each turn.
cards.title: Mandatory Upgrades

cards.flavor: Face your fear.
cards.text:
The runner may spend [Click] to break any subroutine on Janus 1.0.
[Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
cards.title: Janus 1.0

cards.flavor: "Eyes forward please."
cards.text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, trace4– if successful, the Runner cannot access any cards other than Ash 2X3ZB9CY for the remainder of this run.
cards.title: Ash 2X3ZB9CY

cards.text:
When you score Braintrust, place 1 agenda counter on it for every 2 advancement tokens on it over 3.
The rez cost of all ice is lowered by 1 for each agenda counter on Braintrust.
cards.title: Braintrust

cards.flavor: Sometimes uniqueness is overrated.
cards.text: [Subroutine] You and the Runner secretly spend 0[Credits], 1[Credits], or 2[Credits]. Reveal spent credits. End the run if you and the Runner spent a different number of credits.
cards.title: Snowflake

cards.flavor: "We're gonna need a bigger room."
cards.text: [Click]: Trace2– If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
cards.title: Restructured Datapool

cards.flavor: A collection of cast-off cyberjunk. But it doesn't stay junk for long.
cards.text: When you rez TMI, trace2– if unsuccessful, derez TMI. [Subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: TMI

cards.text: When you score Project Atlas, place 1 agenda counter on it for each advancement token on it over 3. Hosted agenda counter: Search R&D for 1 card, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
cards.title: Project Atlas

cards.flavor: A symbol of commerce, but beware its bite.
cards.text: [Subroutine] Trace3– If successful, the Corp gains 3[Credits]. [Subroutine] Trace2– If successful, end the run.
cards.title: Caduceus

cards.flavor: Victōs draconēs numquam deride.
cards.text: When you rez Dracō, you may pay X[Credits] to place X power counters on it. Dracō has +1 strength for each power counter on it. [Subroutine] Trace2 - If successful, give the Runner 1 tag and end the run.
cards.title: Dracō

cards.flavor: There was a certain schadenfreude about throwing away your credits.
cards.text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards you may pay X[Credits] to force the Corp to lose up to X[Credits], then take 1 tag.
cards.title: Vamp

cards.flavor: It's easier to spend when it's not your money.
cards.text:
Place 16[Credits] from the bank on Liberated Account when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Liberated Account, trash it.
[Click]: Take 4[Credits] from Liberated Account.
cards.title: Liberated Account

cards.flavor: T-minus 13 seconds. Leela had to work fast. She jacked in the mesa wire and activated the screen. 7 seconds. The internal SLD was still booting. 4 seconds. The interface flickered to life with an orange glow. 2 seconds. With a tap of a finger she was in.
cards.text: Expose up to 2 cards.
cards.title: Satellite Uplink

cards.flavor: CyberSolutions' e3 line of implants trade strictly in muscle memory and automatic responses, freeing the brain to focus entirely on cerebral tasks.
cards.text: Whenever you break a subroutine on a piece of ice, you may pay 1[Credits] to break 1 additional subroutine on that ice.
cards.title: e3 Feedback Implants

cards.text:
1[Recurring Credits]
Use this credit during traces.
Gain 1[Credits] whenever the Corp rezzes a piece of ice.
cards.title: Compromised Employee

cards.flavor: When you're this good, it's hard not to grow a fan base.
cards.text:
Play only if you made a successful run on R&D, HQ, and Archives this turn.
Add Notoriety to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.
cards.title: Notoriety

cards.flavor: "If your snowball gets big enough, you can make it into a snowman!" - Chaos Theory
cards.text: 1[Credits]: Break barrier subroutine. 1[Credits]: +1 strength. Whenever you use Snowball to break a subroutine, it has +1 strength for the remainder of the run.
cards.title: Snowball

cards.flavor: Archaic but reliable.
cards.text: +1[Memory Unit], +1[Link]
cards.title: Dyson Mem Chip

cards.flavor: The key to the future lies in the past.
cards.text: The trash cost of all installed cards is increased by 1.
cards.title: Encryption Protocol

cards.text: The Runner may spend [Click] to break any subroutine on Sherlock 1.0. [Subroutine] Trace4– If successful, add 1 installed program to the top of the Runner's stack. [Subroutine] Trace4– If successful, add 1 installed program to the top of the Runner's stack.
cards.title: Sherlock 1.0

cards.text: The Runner cannot run on remote servers. Ignore this ability until the end of the turn whenever the Runner runs on a central server.
cards.title: Jinteki: Replicating Perfection

cards.text:
If Fetal AI is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Fetal AI, do 2 net damage. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses Fetal AI from Archives.
As an additional cost to steal Fetal AI, the Runner must pay 2[Credits].
cards.title: Fetal AI

cards.flavor: Smoke and mirrors optional.
cards.text: Move up to 2 advancement tokens from a card to another installed card that can be advanced.
cards.title: Trick of Light

cards.flavor: Peace and violence. Both must lead to the same place.
cards.text: [Subroutine] For the remainder of this run, each piece of ice encountered except Sensei gains "[Subroutine] End the run" after all its other subroutines.
cards.title: Sensei

cards.flavor: Looking out for your interests since 1984.
cards.text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
Give the Runner 2 tags.
cards.title: Big Brother

cards.flavor: Clones whisper of ChiLo as a promised land of freedom.
cards.text: Whenever there is a successful trace during a run on this server, give the Runner 1 tag. Limit 1 region per server.
cards.title: ChiLo City Grid

cards.text: Play only if the Runner made a successful run during his or her last turn. Trace2– If successful, trash 1 piece of hardware with an install cost equal to or less than the amount by which your trace strength exceeded the Runner's link strength.
cards.title: Power Grid Overload

cards.text: Whenever you install a piece of ice protecting this server, you may immediately rez it, lowering its rez cost by 3. Limit 1 region per server.
cards.title: Amazon Industrial Zone

cards.text: When you score Executive Retreat, place 1 agenda counter on it and shuffle HQ into R&D. [Click], hosted agenda counter: Draw 5 cards.
cards.title: Executive Retreat

cards.flavor: No contract. Just a handshake and a fistful of C-6 high explosives.
cards.text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
Trash up to 2 resources.
cards.title: Freelancer

cards.text:
Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, place 1 virus counter on Nerve Agent.
Each virus counter after the first on Nerve Agent allows you to access 1 additional card from HQ whenever you access cards from HQ.
cards.title: Nerve Agent

cards.flavor: "My enhancements are guaranteed for life, and well worth the risk."
cards.text: When your turn begins, you may gain [Click]. If you do, take 1 tag when this turn ends.
cards.title: Joshua B.

cards.flavor: "Think of it as a virtual shock collar for punishing corporate pets." -Andromeda
cards.text:
Play only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn.
Derez a piece of ice.
cards.title: Emergency Shutdown

cards.flavor: Light and form-fitting, its like bulletproof skin.
cards.text: Prevent the first meat damage each turn.
cards.title: Muresh Bodysuit

cards.flavor: "A snitch is a girl's best friend." - Andromeda
cards.text: Once per run, you may expose an unrezzed piece of ice when you approach it. You may then jack out.
cards.title: Snitch

cards.flavor: "Have you met Dinosaurus?"
cards.text: +1[Memory Unit]
cards.title: Chaos Theory: Wünderkind

cards.text: Search your stack or heap for a program. Install that program, ignoring all costs. Shuffle your stack if you searched it. When this turn ends, add the program to the top of your stack if it is still installed.
cards.title: Test Run

cards.text: Dinosaurus can host a single non-AI icebreaker. The memory cost of the hosted icebreaker does not count against your memory limit. Hosted icebreaker has +2 strength. Limit 1 console per player.
cards.title: Dinosaurus

cards.text:
[Click]: Host a program or piece of hardware from your grip on Personal Workshop and place power counters on it equal to its install cost.
1[Credits]: Remove 1 power counter from a hosted card.
When your turn begins, remove 1 power counter from a hosted card.
When there are no power counters left on a hosted card, install it, ignoring all costs.
cards.title: Personal Workshop

cards.flavor: "I'm just thankful that the brain damage is reversible. With the support of the city of New Angeles, I hope to be on my feet and back to practicing my art very soon." - Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
cards.text: Your maximum hand size is increased by 2.
cards.title: Public Sympathy

cards.text: When you score Project Vitruvius, place 1 agenda counter on it for each advancement token on it over 3. Hosted agenda counter: Add 1 card from Archives to HQ.
cards.title: Project Vitruvius

cards.flavor: Dont Tread On Me
cards.text: [Subroutine] Trace3– If successful, the Runner loses [Click], if able. [Subroutine] Trace3– If successful, end the run.
cards.title: Viper

cards.text: If Edge of World is installed and you pay 3[Credits] when the Runner accesses it, do 1 brain damage for each piece of ice protecting this server.
cards.title: Edge of World

cards.flavor: "You haven't run until you've seen the cybersun drift down behind the Great City, the space around you rippling with colors you can't imagine." - Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
cards.text: Choose a server. Arrange the ice protecting that server in any order.
cards.title: Sunset

cards.text:
When your turn begins, take 1[Credits] from Marked Accounts, if able.
[Click]: Place 3[Credits] from the bank on Marked Accounts.
cards.title: Marked Accounts

cards.flavor: "Try to close it. Go on. See what it does." - Chaos Theory
cards.text:
When the Runner encounters Pop-up Window, you gain 1[Credits].
[Subroutine] End the run unless the Runner pays 1[Credits].
cards.title: Pop-up Window

cards.flavor: Chop chop.
cards.text: Woodcutter can be advanced only while rezzed and gains "[Subroutine] Do 1 net damage." for each advancement token on it.
cards.title: Woodcutter

cards.flavor: The Division of Fringe Applications' revenue increased 37% year-over-year after corporate discovered that most of their projects made really fun toys.
cards.text: Choose a piece of ice. Gain 1[Credits] for each advancement token on that ice.
cards.title: Commercialization

cards.text:
Place 14[Credits] from the bank on Private Contracts when it is rezzed. When there are no credits left on Private Contracts, trash it.
[Click]: Take 2[Credits] from Private Contracts.
cards.title: Private Contracts

cards.flavor: Three heads. One big headache.
cards.text: When you rez Chimera, choose sentry, code gate, or barrier. Chimera gains that subtype until derezzed. When a turn ends, derez Chimera. [Subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Chimera

cards.flavor: "Saved my bacon more than once, but gives a wicked sense of déjà vu." - Whizzard
cards.text: [Trash]: Prevent a trace. That trace initiates again with a base trace strength of 0.
cards.title: Disrupter

cards.flavor: It always strikes twice.
cards.text: 2[Credits]: Break up to 2 code gate subroutines. 1[Credits]: +1 strength.
cards.title: Force of Nature

cards.flavor: "They're mindless tools of destruction, good for little else. Nice guys, though. Some of my best friends are scrubbers." - Ji "Noise" Reilly
cards.text:
2[Recurring Credits]
Use these credits to trash cards.
cards.title: Scrubber

cards.flavor: Twice the fun.
cards.text: +1[Memory Unit] Once per turn, you may immediately make another run when a successful run ends. Limit 1 console per player.
cards.title: Doppelgänger

cards.flavor: Cyberspace's strongest glue.
cards.text: [Trash]: Derez a piece of ice. Use this ability only after breaking all the subroutines of that ice during a single encounter.
cards.title: Crescentus

cards.flavor: Didn't see that coming.
cards.text: [Trash]: Break any number of AP subroutines. [Trash]: Prevent any amount of net damage.
cards.title: Deus X

cards.flavor: "I don't care what the studies show. From my experience, I can ingest three cans of Diesel an hour for up to twelve hours before going into cardiac arrest." -heard during the eleventh hour
cards.text: [Click], [Trash]: Gain [Click][Click].
cards.title: All-nighter

cards.flavor: Few corporate employees have such wide-sweeping security clearance as the janitorial staff. Most corps foolishly think they're too dim-witted to take advantage of it.
cards.text:
2[Recurring Credits]
Use these credits to install hardware.
cards.title: Inside Man

cards.flavor: "My boss rewards quality work. If you know what's good for you, you'll keep it up."
cards.text: When your turn begins, gain 1[Credits] if you have at least 2[Link].
cards.title: Underworld Contact

cards.flavor: Green-two clearance is the highest level of security a corp can gain access to. Legally, anyway.
cards.text: Gain 3[Credits] and draw 1 card.
cards.title: Green Level Clearance

cards.flavor: Time just slips away.
cards.text:
[Subroutine] The Runner loses [Click], if able.
[Subroutine] The Runner loses [Click], if able.
[Subroutine] The Runner loses [Click], if able.
cards.title: Hourglass

cards.flavor:
so very still, even
cherry blossoms are not stirred
by the temple bell
           -Fuhaku
cards.text:
2[Recurring Credits]
Use these credits to rez ice.
cards.title: Dedicated Server

cards.text: [Subroutine] You and the Runner secretly spend 0[Credits], 1[Credits] or 2[Credits]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, move Bullfrog so that it is the outermost piece of ice protecting another server (the Runner continues the run from this new position and is now running on this new server).
cards.title: Bullfrog

cards.flavor: Where one thing ends, another begins.
cards.text: [Subroutine] Trace4– If successful, the Runner cannot make another run this turn. [Subroutine] Trace4– If successful, end the run.
cards.title: Uroboros

cards.flavor: This is the net. We work here. We're cops.
cards.text:
X[Recurring Credits]
Use these credits during traces. X is the number of links the Runner has.
cards.title: Net Police

cards.flavor: Constructing Cyberspace.
cards.text:
1[Recurring Credits]
Use this credit to advance ice.
cards.title: Weyland Consortium: Because We Built It

cards.flavor: It's really hard to lose a government contract.
cards.text: [Click], [Click]: Gain 4[Credits].
cards.title: Government Contracts

cards.flavor: Thou shall not pass.
cards.text: Tyrant can be advanced only while rezzed and gains "[Subroutine] End the run." for each advancement token on it.
cards.title: Tyrant

cards.text: Rez a piece of ice, ignoring all costs, and install Oversight AI on that ice as a hosted condition counter with the text "Trash host ice if all its subroutines are broken during a single encounter."
cards.title: Oversight AI

cards.flavor: It didn't look like the headquarters of a multi-billion cred company. Probably because it wasn't.
cards.text: Forfeit False Lead: The Runner loses [Click][Click], if able.
cards.title: False Lead

cards.flavor: You must yell "surge" to get the full effect.
cards.text:
Play only if you placed at least 1 virus counter on a program this turn.
Place 2 virus counters on that program.
cards.title: Surge

cards.flavor:
And all should cry, Beware! Beware!
His flashing eyes, his floating hair!
Weave a circle round him thrice,
And close your eyes with holy dread,
For he on honey-dew hath fed,
And drunk the milk of Paradise.
-Samuel Taylor Coleridge
cards.text: The rez cost of all ice is increased by 1.
cards.title: Xanadu

cards.flavor: "I run with the best."
cards.text: You draw a starting hand of 9 cards.
cards.title: Andromeda: Dispossessed Ristie

cards.flavor: She preferred to do business in a club. Something about the lights and dancers clouded the judgment of the corporate simpletons she met there.
cards.text: Remove 1 tag. You may pay 1[Credits] to add Networking to your grip instead of trashing it.
cards.title: Networking

cards.flavor: If you don't have someone on the inside, find someone on the inside who's fond of desk ornaments.
cards.text: Whenever you access cards from HQ, access 1 additional card from HQ.
cards.title: HQ Interface

cards.text:
X[Recurring Credits]
Use these credits during runs on HQ. X is the number of virus counters on Pheromones.
Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, place 1 virus counter on Pheromones.
cards.title: Pheromones

cards.flavor: She at her P.A.D. I at my rig. Low lights. Smooth jazz. Love blooms.
cards.text: Draw 5 cards.
cards.title: Quality Time

cards.flavor: Do you really need another one?
cards.text: Whenever you install a piece of hardware (including Replicator), you may search your stack for another copy of that hardware, reveal it, and add it your grip. Shuffle your stack.
cards.title: Replicator

cards.flavor:
"The itsy bitsy spider went up the data spout…"
-Chaos Theory
cards.text: If you have at least 2[Link], the memory cost of Creeper is 0, even if it is not installed. 2[Credits]: Break sentry subroutine. 1[Credits]: +1 strength.
cards.title: Creeper

cards.flavor: Early permutations of the kraken proved to be insatiable, ice-devouring marauders. Not much has changed.
cards.text:
Play only if you stole an agenda this turn.
Choose a server. The Corp trashes 1 piece of ice protecting that server.
cards.title: Kraken

cards.flavor: "You aren't the only type of runner in New Angeles."
cards.text:
You cannot use Kati Jones more than once per turn.
[Click]: Place 3[Credits] from the bank on Kati Jones.
[Click]: Take all credits from Kati Jones.
cards.title: Kati Jones

cards.text:
Place 16[Credits] from the bank on Eve Campaign when it is rezzed. When there are no credits left on Eve Campaign, trash it.
When your turn begins, take 2[Credits] from Eve Campaign.
cards.title: Eve Campaign

cards.flavor: Also known as "development hell."
cards.text: Shuffle 1 card from HQ into R&D.
cards.title: Rework

cards.flavor: "This ice sucks." -g00ru
cards.text: [Subroutine] The Runner cannot jack out for the remainder of this run. Trash Whirlpool.
cards.title: Whirlpool

cards.flavor: Despite its appearance, the Hokusai Grid is the most notorious research facility at Jinteki.
cards.text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, do 1 net damage. Limit 1 region per server.
cards.title: Hokusai Grid

cards.flavor: Sniff.
cards.text: [Subroutine] Trace2– If successful, look at a number of cards from the top of the Runner's stack equal to the amount by which your trace strength exceeded his or her link strength. Trash 1 of those cards, and arrange the rest in any order.
cards.title: Data Hound

cards.flavor: Keeping tabs on the world, one screen at a time.
cards.text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, trace5– if successful, give the runner 1 tag. If unsuccessful, trash Bernice Mai.
cards.title: Bernice Mai

cards.flavor: You're not in Kansas anymore.
cards.text: Salvage can be advanced only while rezzed and gains “[Subroutine] Trace2– If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.” for each advancement token on it.
cards.title: Salvage

cards.flavor: "A job done once is a job done right."
cards.text:
2[Recurring Credits]
Use these credits to advance cards in or protecting this server.
cards.title: Simone Diego

cards.flavor: "It's kind of like an anagram." -designer Phoenix
cards.text: Trace7– If successful, trash 1 virtual resource or 1 link.
cards.title: Foxfire

cards.text: Make a run on Archives. If successful, instead of accessing cards you may install a program from your heap, ignoring all costs.
cards.title: Retrieval Run

cards.text:
2[Credits]: Break ice subroutine.
X is the number of virus counters on Darwin.
When your turn begins, you may pay 1[Credits] to place 1 virus counter on Darwin.
cards.title: Darwin

cards.flavor: A two-way solution to a one-way problem, the data leak reversal, or DLR for short, is a misnomer. There is no actual reversal of data, only the creation of a parallel peer-to-peer link with the initial source.
cards.text:
Install only if you made a successful run on a central server this turn.
If you are tagged, Data Leak Reversal gains "[Click]: The Corp trashes the top card of R&D."
cards.title: Data Leak Reversal

cards.flavor: Do you believe in faeries?
cards.text: 0[Credits]: Break sentry subroutine. 1[Credits]: +1 strength. When an encounter with a piece of ice in which you used Faerie to break a subroutine ends, trash Faerie.
cards.title: Faerie

cards.flavor:
"We're always happy to help, Mr. Santiago."
"I appreciate it, Mr. Li."
"We'll be in touch. And, Gabriel…"
"Yes?"
"Don't leave town."
cards.text: [Click]: Draw 2 cards. Add 1 of these cards to the bottom of your stack.
cards.title: Mr. Li

cards.flavor: A little corporate restructuring is necessary once in a while.
cards.text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, instead of accessing cards you may look at the top 5 cards of R&D and arrange them in any order.
cards.title: Indexing

cards.flavor: Works best at your own desk.
cards.text: Whenever you access cards from R&D, access 1 additional card from R&D.
cards.title: R&D Interface

cards.text:
Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, place 1 virus counter on Deep Thought.
If there are at least 3 virus counters on Deep Thought, it gains "When your turn begins, you may look at the top card of R&D."
cards.title: Deep Thought

cards.flavor: "New Angeles is the jewel of modern civilization, and its government the envy of nations." -Mayor Wells
cards.text:
2[Credits]: Avoid 1 tag.
Trash New Angeles City Hall when you steal an agenda.
cards.title: New Angeles City Hall

cards.flavor: "That's against the rules. The Creators will be angry."
cards.text:
The Runner may spend [Click] to break any subroutine on Eli 1.0.
[Subroutine] End the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Eli 1.0

cards.flavor: Known for luxury hoppers and a delectable sauerkraut.
cards.text: As an additional cost to make a run on this server, the Runner must spend [Click]. Limit 1 region per server.
cards.title: Ruhr Valley

cards.flavor: I will serve you…for a time.
cards.text:
Ronin can be advanced.
If there are at least 4 advancement tokens on Ronin, it gains "[Click], [Trash]: Do 3 net damage."
cards.title: Ronin

cards.flavor: "Looks like someone is being naughty…"
cards.text: Once per run, when the Runner approaches a piece of ice protecting this server, you may swap that ice with a piece of ice from HQ. The new ice is installed unrezzed.
cards.title: Midori

cards.flavor: *Some restrictions may apply. Scan this card to find out more.
cards.text: Your maximum hand size is increased by 1.
cards.title: NBN: The World is Yours*

cards.text:
When you score Project Beale, place 1 agenda counter on it for every 2 advancement tokens on it over 3.
Project Beale is worth 1 additional agenda point for each agenda counter on it.
cards.title: Project Beale

cards.text: Play only if the Runner stole an agenda during his or her last turn. Trace6– If successful, give the Runner tags equal to the amount by which your trace strength exceeded his or her link strength.
cards.title: Midseason Replacements

cards.flavor: A bright light blossomed, and then the console went dark. That's when she smelled smoke.
cards.text: [Subroutine]Trace6– If successful, trash 1 piece of hardware, do 2 meat damage (cannot be prevented), and end the run.
cards.title: Flare

cards.flavor: They don't call them dedicated for nothing
cards.text: If the Runner is tagged, Dedicated Response Team gains "Whenever a successful run ends, do 2 meat damage."
cards.title: Dedicated Response Team

cards.flavor: "If I had to describe the bugs in one word, it would be '****ing annoying.'" -Whizzard
cards.text: [Subroutine] Trace0– If successful, the Runner trashes 1 program.
cards.title: Burke Bugs

cards.flavor: There were several ways to win a corporate war. One of them was to bring out the bazookas.
cards.text: If you have at least 7[Credits] when you score Corporate War, gain 7[Credits]; otherwise, lose all credits in your credit pool.
cards.title: Corporate War

cards.flavor: The densest information cluster in the galaxy.
cards.text: Your maximum hand size is equal to the number of credits in your credit pool.
cards.title: Cerebral Imaging: Infinite Frontiers

cards.flavor: The Once and Future Android.
cards.text: You cannot include Jinteki cards in this deck.
cards.title: Custom Biotics: Engineered for Success

cards.text: Before taking your first turn, you may install up to 3 pieces of ice, with no more than a single piece of ice per server. Draw until you have 5 cards in HQ.
cards.title: NEXT Design: Guarding the Net

cards.text:
When you score Director Haas' Pet Project, you may create a new remote server by installing up to 3 cards from HQ and/or Archives in that server and/or protecting that server (one at a time), ignoring all install costs.
Limit 1 Director Haas' Pet Project per deck.
cards.title: Director Haas' Pet Project

cards.text: Place 3 agenda counters on Efficiency Committee when you score it. [Click], hosted agenda counter: Gain [Click][Click]. You cannot advance cards for the remainder of this turn.
cards.title: Efficiency Committee

cards.text: Place 3 agenda counters on Project Wotan when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: Choose a rezzed piece of bioroid ice currently being approached. For the remainder of this run, that ice gains "[Subroutine] End the run." after all its other subroutines.
cards.title: Project Wotan

cards.flavor: "Why limit our best assets to our own servers? The enemy doesn't stay passively at home, waiting for us to come to him. Why should we?" -Director Haas
cards.text: Whenever the Runner suffers at least 1 brain damage, do 1 net damage.
cards.title: Sentinel Defense Program

cards.flavor: The Alix model was based on a successful hedge fund manager but she had a tendency to burn out. Literally.
cards.text:
Place 1 power counter on Alix T4LB07 whenever you install a card.
[Click],[Trash]: Gain 2[Credits] for each power counter on Alix T4LB07.
cards.title: Alix T4LB07

cards.text:
Cerebral Overwriter can be advanced.
If you pay 3[Credits] when the Runner accesses Cerebral Overwriter, do 1 brain damage for each advancement token on Cerebral Overwriter.
cards.title: Cerebral Overwriter

cards.text:
You have 1 additional [Click] to spend each turn.
If Director Haas is trashed while being accessed, add her to the Runner's score area as an agenda worth 2 agenda points.
cards.title: Director Haas

cards.text: Haas Arcology AI can be advanced only while unrezzed. [Click], hosted advancement token: Gain [Click][Click]. Use this ability only once per turn.
cards.title: Haas Arcology AI

cards.flavor: Thomas, the director's son, has been carefully groomed to inherit the corporation since before he was born. His favorite pastime appears to be disappointing his mother.
cards.text:
Thomas Haas can be advanced.
[Trash]: Gain 2[Credits] for each advancement token on Thomas Haas.
cards.title: Thomas Haas

cards.text: Rez a piece of bioroid ice, ignoring all costs, and install Bioroid Efficiency Research on that ice as a hosted condition counter with the text "Trash Bioroid Efficiency Research and derez host ice if all of its subroutines are broken during a single encounter."
cards.title: Bioroid Efficiency Research

cards.flavor: Success is defined by the safety of data, not the safety of potential intruders.
cards.text:
Play only if the Runner made an unsuccessful run during his or her last turn.
Gain 7[Credits].
cards.title: Successful Demonstration

cards.flavor: The realm beyond is still forbidden.
cards.text:
The Runner can spend [Click][Click] to break up to 2 subroutines on Heimdall 2.0.
[Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage and end the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Heimdall 2.0

cards.flavor: "Yeah. It made a loud noise, I got scared, and I jacked out. I still think I made the right decision." -g00ru
cards.text: [Subroutine] You may install and rez a piece of bioroid ice from HQ or Archives, ignoring all costs, placing it directly behind Howler. If you do, derez that piece of ice and trash Howler after the run is completed.
cards.title: Howler

cards.flavor: The game has changed.
cards.text: The Runner can spend [Click][Click] to break up to 2 subroutines on Ichi 2.0. [Subroutine] Trash 1 program. [Subroutine] Trash 1 program. [Subroutine] Trace3– If successful, give the Runner 1 tag and do 1 brain damage.
cards.title: Ichi 2.0

cards.flavor: Sometimes you just have to guess.
cards.text: [Subroutine] You may install a piece of ice from HQ as the outermost piece of ice protecting this server, ignoring all install costs.
cards.title: Minelayer

cards.text: The Runner can spend [Click][Click] to break up to 2 subroutines on Viktor 2.0. Hosted power counter: Do 1 brain damage. [Subroutine] Trace2– If successful, place 1 power counter on Viktor 2.0. [Subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Viktor 2.0

cards.flavor: A mind of meat! How does it work?
cards.text:
The Runner can spend [Click] to break any subroutine on Zed 1.0.
[Subroutine] If the Runner has spent at least 1 [Click] to break a subroutine during this run, do 1 brain damage.
[Subroutine] If the Runner has spent at least 1 [Click] to break a subroutine during this run, do 1 brain damage.
cards.title: Zed 1.0

cards.text: Awakening Center can host bioroid ice (each piece is installed facedown, ignoring all install costs). Whenever the Runner passes all of the ice protecting this server, you may rez a piece of ice on Awakening Center, lowering the rez cost by 7[Credits], to force the Runner to encounter it. Trash that ice after the run is completed.
cards.title: Awakening Center

cards.text: If the Runner is about to break a subroutine on a piece of bioroid ice protecting this server, you may rez Tyr's Hand. [Trash]: Prevent a subroutine from being broken on a piece of bioroid ice protecting this server.
cards.title: Tyr's Hand

cards.flavor: Sell the dream-show them how very much they want to be rich, and they'll convince themselves that someday, they will be. How can they revolt against their future selves? -the New Gospel of Wealth
cards.text: [Click], [Click]: Gain 3[Credits].
cards.title: Gila Hands Arcology

cards.flavor: "Just another factory, making good corporate drones for the machine. Their CS department is the best in the world, though." -g00ru
cards.text: [Click], 1[Credits]: Search R&D for a piece of ice, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
cards.title: Levy University

cards.flavor: "There's only a 5% chance this could result in a general failure."
cards.text:
Gain 2[Credits] when your turn begins.
Trash Server Diagnostics when you install a piece of ice.
cards.title: Server Diagnostics

cards.flavor: The principle behind ice is not to keep everyone out, but to let only some people in. This ice denies entry on all but a select few ports that might change with the time of day or picosecond of connection. If you don't know what port to use, you're not getting in. Period.
cards.text: [Subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Bastion

cards.flavor: "Cheap, off-the-shelf data protection. Cheap for them, that is. Not for us." -Ele "Smoke" Scovak
cards.text:
[Subroutine] The Runner must pay 2[Credits], if able. If the Runner cannot pay 2[Credits], end the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Datapike

cards.flavor: "I was not; I was; I am not; I am all."
cards.text: The first piece of ice you encounter each turn gains code gate until the end of the run.
cards.title: Rielle "Kit" Peddler: Transhuman

cards.flavor: "New technology destroys the old."
cards.text: The first copy of each program in this deck does not count against your influence limit.
cards.title: The Professor: Keeper of Knowledge

cards.flavor: "I can make that work."
cards.text: Whenever you install a program from your heap, draw 1 card.
cards.title: Exile: Streethawk

cards.text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards, rearrange any number of ice protecting all servers (without rezzing or derezzing the ice). The same number of ice must be protecting each server after the rearrangement as before.
cards.title: Escher

cards.flavor: Wheeeee!
cards.text: Make a run. If successful, instead of accessing cards, remove up to 3 advancement tokens from a single card in or protecting the attacked server.
cards.title: Exploratory Romp

cards.flavor: "Idealism's great, but it don't keep you in soybeef tacos." -Matt "TheMerc" Thomas
cards.text: Trash up to 5 programs from your grip. Gain 2[Credits] for each program trashed.
cards.title: Freelance Coding Contract

cards.flavor: One man's trash.
cards.text:
As an additional cost to play this card, trash an installed program.
Install a program from your grip or heap, lowering the install cost of that program by the cost of the program trashed.
cards.title: Scavenge

cards.flavor: Spend too much time in the AR Lab and someone might notice. Unless you're the head of it, that is.
cards.text: Shuffle your grip and heap into your stack. Draw 5 cards. Remove Levy AR Lab Access from the game instead of trashing it.
cards.title: Levy AR Lab Access

cards.text: +3[Memory Unit] When you install Monolith, install up to 3 programs from your grip, lowering the install cost of each by 4[Credits]. Trash a program from your grip: Prevent 1 brain or net damage. Limit 1 console per player.
cards.title: Monolith

cards.flavor: It still hurts, a bit, the first time. The second time, you feel nothing at all. But don't push your luck.
cards.text:
3[Credits]: Prevent 1 net damage.
[Trash]: Prevent up to 2 brain damage.
cards.title: Feedback Filter

cards.flavor: It is good practice to backup the backup.
cards.text: [Trash]: Install a program from your heap (paying the install cost).
cards.title: Clone Chip

cards.text:
Omni-Drive can host a single program of 1[Memory Unit] or less. The memory cost of the hosted program does not count against your memory limit.
1[Recurring Credits]
Use this credit to pay for using the hosted program.
cards.title: Omni-Drive

cards.flavor: We are shaped by our thoughts; we become what we think.
cards.text:
When you install Atman, you may pay X[Credits] to put X power counters on Atman.
Atman has +1 strength for each power counter on it.
1[Credits]: Break ice subroutine on a piece of ice that has strength equal to Atman's strength.
cards.title: Atman

cards.flavor: "No line that they lay could catch a shadow on the wall…"
cards.text: 1[Recurring Credits] Use this credit to pay for using icebreakers.
cards.title: Cloak

cards.flavor: "…and once the shadow rises, the curtain shall fall." -revenant
cards.text: 1[Credits]: Break sentry subroutine. 1[Credits]: +5 strength. Use this ability only by spending a credit from a stealth card.
cards.title: Dagger

cards.text:
Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, place 1 virus counter on Chakana.
If there are at least 3 virus counters on Chakana, the advancement requirement of all agendas is increased by 1.
cards.title: Chakana

cards.text: 1[Credits]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[Credits]: +1 strength. When you install Cyber-Cypher, choose a server. Cyber-Cypher can only be used during a run on the chosen server.
cards.title: Cyber-Cypher

cards.flavor: Perfect for flooding servers.
cards.text:
2[Recurring Credits]
Use these credits to trash assets.
cards.title: Paricia

cards.flavor: "Make sure you tell the source code which executable you want it to compile into. One time I left my rig for a couple of minutes, and when I came back all of my files had been replaced with cat vids." - The Professor
cards.text: 2[Credits], [Trash]: Search your stack for a program and install it (paying the install cost). Shuffle your stack.
cards.title: Self-modifying Code

cards.flavor: Out there, the thousand-petaled lotus symbolizes detachment from illusion. In here, it is the birthplace of a higher consciousness. Something infinitely pure.
cards.text:
2[Recurring Credits]
Use these credits to install programs (you cannot use Sahasrara to install a program that trashes Sahasrara).
cards.title: Sahasrara

cards.flavor: "The Incans believed that the sun god resided in the Haman Pacha, the upper realm of the cosmos. They just didn't know that the Haman Pacha hadn't been discovered yet." -The Professor
cards.text: 1[Credits]: Break barrier subroutine. 2[Credits]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
cards.title: Inti

cards.flavor: Sometimes it doesn't matter how expensive your rig his, or how many credits are in your account, or even your skill as a runner. Most of the time, a simple handshake and a name are all you need.
cards.text: [Click]: Gain 1[Credits] and draw 1 card.
cards.title: Professional Contacts

cards.flavor: Some people have their own satellite receiver. Others have their own satellite.
cards.text:
+1[Link]
Your maximum hand size is increased by 1.
cards.title: Borrowed Satellite

cards.flavor: "If you know the source code you can write to beat it, or just rejigger it a little and make it yours. That works, too." -Exile
cards.text:
Whenever the Corp rezzes a piece of ice, place 1[Credits] on Ice Analyzer.
You may use credits on Ice Analyzer to install programs.
cards.title: Ice Analyzer

cards.flavor: The data was better than she could have ever imagined. This Santiago fellow really knew what he was doing. She began to imagine the havoc she could wreak at the upcoming charity dinner…
cards.text: Make a run. After the run is completed, gain 5[Credits] if it was successful.
cards.title: Dirty Laundry

cards.flavor: "We say 'cyber-terrorist', they hear 'underground celebrity.'" -Michael Muhama, professional expert.
cards.text:
Place 8[Credits] from the bank on Daily Casts when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Daily Casts, trash it.
Take 2[Credits] from Daily Casts when your turn begins.
cards.title: Daily Casts

cards.flavor: Just me, a cup of YucaBean, and last night's Hong Kong Trunk sniffed packets. I call that a good morning.
cards.text: [Click], [Click], [Trash]: Play an event from your heap (paying its play cost).
cards.title: Same Old Thing

cards.flavor: A dangerous game, but well worth playing.
cards.text:
The advancement requirement of all agendas is increased by 1.
As an additional cost to steal an agenda, you must pay 3[Credits].
Trash The Source when an agenda is scored or stolen.
cards.title: The Source

cards.flavor: "Bioroid intrusion isn't impossible, despite the bluster of Haas-Bioroid. But it is dangerous." -Noise
cards.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [Click].
Forfeit an agenda. If you do, give the Corp 1 bad publicity.
cards.title: Frame Job

cards.text: [Click]: Host Pawn on an outermost piece of ice protecting a central server. Whenever you make a successful run, move Pawn to the piece of ice directly after the current ice hosting Pawn, if able; otherwise, trash Pawn instead and install a Caïssa program from your grip or heap, ignoring all costs.
cards.title: Pawn

cards.text: [Click]: Host Rook on a piece of ice not hosting a Caïssa. If already hosted, Rook can be hosted only on ice protecting this server or on ice in the same position (counting from the innermost spot) protecting another server. The rez cost of each piece of ice protecting this server is increased by 2.
cards.title: Rook

cards.text: As an additional cost to play this event, spend [Click]. Search your stack for a connection, reveal it, and add it to your grip. You may install that connection (paying its install cost). Shuffle your stack.
cards.title: Hostage

cards.flavor: Simple in principle, a drip virus drains fractions of currency from their accounts into yours.
cards.text:
Whenever the corp spends a [Click] to draw 1 card or gain 1[Credits] (not through a card ability), place 1 virus counter on Gorman Drip v1.
[Click], [Trash]: Gain 1[Credits] for each virus counter on Gorman Drip v1.
cards.title: Gorman Drip v1

cards.flavor: "I originally designed it for someone else, but it was so useful I decided to keep it for myself." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
cards.text: 1[Recurring Credits] Use this credit to pay for using decoders.
cards.title: Lockpick

cards.flavor: "What if this ice wants to be free?" -Rielle "Kit" Peddler
cards.text: Whenever you pass a piece of unrezzed ice, you may trash False Echo. If you do, the Corp must rez that ice or add it to HQ.
cards.title: False Echo

cards.flavor: Normal people–sane people–do not embark on a life of cybercrime. Who can say what motivates the deranged mind? An imagined slight, personal failings blamed on external forces, or the ever-popular lust for money? -Michael Muhama, Musings on Cybercrime
cards.text: When your turn begins, you may look at the top card of your stack.
cards.title: Motivation

cards.flavor: "I've been logging online with babes all day. Don't worry, the connections are clean. I guarantee it."
cards.text:
The first time you make a successful run each turn, draw 1 card.
The first time you make an unsuccessful run each turn, take 1 tag.
cards.title: John Masanori

cards.flavor: Who wants to start a war?
cards.text: When you score Project Ares, the Runner trashes 1 of his or her installed cards for each advancement token on Project Ares over 4. If the runner trashes at least 1 card, take 1 bad publicity.
cards.title: Project Ares

cards.flavor: NEXT Design's ice provides the discerning business with a suite of ice that creates a daunting security presence for intruders.
cards.text: NEXT Bronze has +1 strength for each rezzed piece of NEXT ice. [Subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: NEXT Bronze

cards.flavor: When Miranda Rhapsody showed up with a teacup giraffe, suddenly everybody wanted one.
cards.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click].
Reveal up to 5 cards in HQ to the Runner. Gain 2[Credits] for each card revealed.
cards.title: Celebrity Gift

cards.flavor: Himitsu-Bako is a simple ice barrier that appears as a digital puzzle box. What makes it special is the ease with which it can be uninstalled and installed in a different server, throwing up barriers in unexpected places and giving any intruder a curious feeling of déjà vu.
cards.text:
1[Credits]: Add Himitsu-Bako to HQ.
[Subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Himitsu-Bako

cards.flavor: "The thing about journalism is there's always a better story around the corner. Soon, they smelled blood elsewhere, and the world forgot about me. But I didn't forget." -The Professor
cards.text: When you score Character Assassination, trash 1 resource (cannot be prevented).
cards.title: Character Assassination

cards.flavor: "It is my job to ensure our creations are the perfect companions and edutainment for tomorrow's consumers."
cards.text: [Click]: Draw 2 cards. Remove Jackson Howard from the game: Shuffle up to 3 cards from Archives to R&D.
cards.title: Jackson Howard

cards.text: As additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click]. Trace2– If successful, reveal the Runner's grip and trash a number of resources and/or events from it up to the amount by which your trace strength exceeded the Runner's link strength. If unsuccessful, take 1 bad publicity.
cards.title: Invasion of Privacy

cards.flavor: Pumping water into deep sea thermal vents produced huge amounts of energy. A profitable side effect.
cards.text: Place 2 agenda counters on Geothermal Fracking when you score it. [Click], hosted agenda counter: Gain 7[Credits] and take 1 bad publicity.
cards.title: Geothermal Fracking

cards.text:
When you rez Swarm, take 1 bad publicity.
Swarm can be advanced and gains "[Subroutine] Trash 1 program unless the Runner pays 3[Credits]." for each advancement token on it.
cards.title: Swarm

cards.flavor: Your free trial expired. Upgrade to the full version?
cards.text: Purge virus counters.
cards.title: Cyberdex Trial

cards.flavor: "The Grim of legend was one of many so-called 'black dog' myths common to Gaelic and English-speaking communities. What's fascinating is that it has propagated to the network, where it lives on as a program that, or so the story goes, hunts for the unwary." -The Professor
cards.text:
When you rez Grim, take 1 bad publicity.
[Subroutine] Trash 1 program.
cards.title: Grim

cards.text: [Click]: Host Bishop on a piece of ice not hosting a Caïssa. If already hosted, Bishop can be hosted only on ice protecting a central server if Bishop is on ice protecting a remote server, or on ice protecting a remote server if Bishop is on ice protecting a central server. Host ice has -2 strength.
cards.title: Bishop

cards.flavor: Installing 1001 programs puts you in the hacker hall of fame, or would if such an institution actually existed.
cards.text:
Scheherazade can host any number of programs.
Whenever you install a program on Scheherazade, gain 1[Credits].
cards.title: Scheherazade

cards.flavor: Noise decided to go back to school. He applied for research grants at fifteen of the most prestigious universities. Then he hacked in and approved his applications. Breakfast time.
cards.text: When your turn begins, gain 2[Credits] and lose [Click].
cards.title: Hard at Work

cards.flavor: Just like in the real world, sometimes it is best to send in the clone to do the dirty work.
cards.text: Make a run. You may jack out when you encounter the first piece of ice.
cards.title: Recon

cards.flavor: The copycat function should be used with extreme caution, or you might end up on the wrong side of cyberspace.
cards.text: Whenever you pass a piece of ice, you may trash Copycat. If you do, choose another rezzed copy of that piece of ice protecting any server. The run continues as if you had just passed the chosen piece of ice (you are now running from the new position).
cards.title: Copycat

cards.flavor: It's efficient as all hell, for certain very large values of "efficient". The whale avatar is either a nice touch or a tragic misapplication of programmer man-hour, depending on who you ask. -BT's Guide to Icebreaking
cards.text: 3[Credits]: Break up to 3 code gate subroutines. 3[Credits]: +5 strength.
cards.title: Leviathan

cards.flavor: "I've got a surprise for you."
cards.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [Click].
Reveal the top card of your stack. You may install that card, lowering the install cost by 10[Credits], if able; otherwise, trash it.
cards.title: Eureka!

cards.flavor: "Why is data deleted? Maybe they don't want it to be found. Or maybe it's just useless. The useless data is the kind you want." -The Professor
cards.text: Whenever you make a successful run on Archives, instead of accessing cards you may choose 1 faceup card from Archives and add it to the top of R&D.
cards.title: Record Reconstructor

cards.flavor: A VoicePAD is a personal access device with most of its functions ripped out. Just about all it's good for is making voice-calls and managing your contacts. The only reason to even have one is for its anonymity, which for a certain kind of person is all the reason one needs.
cards.text:
1[Recurring Credits]
Use this credit to play events.
cards.title: Prepaid VoicePAD

cards.text:
[Subroutine] End the run unless the Runner spends [Click][Click].
[Subroutine] End the run unless the Runner pays 3[Credits].
[Subroutine] End the run unless the Runner trashes 1 installed program.
[Subroutine] End the run unless the Runner takes 1 brain damage.
cards.title: Wotan

cards.text: Play only if the Runner installed a resource on his or her last turn. Trace2– If successful, add 1 installed resource to the top of the Runner's stack. If unsuccessful, take 1 bad publicity.
cards.title: Hellion Alpha Test

cards.flavor: "They call it 'retirement'. I call it 'euthenasia'." -Ken "Express" Tenma
cards.text:
When you score Clone Retirement, you may remove 1 bad publicity.
When the Runner steals Clone Retirement, the Corp takes 1 bad publicity.
cards.title: Clone Retirement

cards.flavor: Writing a program that can pass the Turing test is easy. The Gibson-Akamatsu test is a higher bar, and the only AIs to clear it thus far have been the androids. Even some humans have been known to fail.
cards.text: The Runner cannot use AI programs to break subroutines on Swordsman. [Subroutine] Trash 1 AI program. [Subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
cards.title: Swordsman

cards.flavor: He signed for it, hand shaking in anticipation.
cards.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click].
Place up to 2 advancement tokens on a card that can be advanced.
cards.title: Shipment from SanSan

cards.text: When you rez Muckraker, take 1 bad publicity. [Subroutine] Trace1– If successful, give the Runner 1 tag. [Subroutine] Trace2– If successful, give the Runner 1 tag. [Subroutine] Trace3– If successful, give the Runner 1 tag. [Subroutine] End the run if the Runner is tagged.
cards.title: Muckraker

cards.flavor: "I use bioroids because I can wipe their memories or just blow their brains out when the job is done. No witnesses means no witnesses."
cards.text: Whenever you do meat damage, do 1 additional meat damage.
cards.title: The Cleaners

cards.flavor: "It's not personal. Urban renewal is a necessity of the modern world. It's always someone's home, yours is no different."
cards.text: When you rez Elizabeth Mills, remove 1 bad publicity. [Click], [Trash]: Trash 1 location. Take 1 bad publicity.
cards.title: Elizabeth Mills

cards.text:
Install only in a remote server.
The Runner cannot initiate a run on this server. 
Whenever the Runner makes a successful run on HQ, trash Off the Grid.
cards.title: Off the Grid

cards.flavor: It was surprisingly easy to make creds…if you didn't care about how you made them.
cards.text: When you score Profiteering, take up to 3 bad publicity. Gain 5[Credits] for each bad publicity taken.
cards.title: Profiteering

cards.flavor: There are many names for those in the Administration Department. But if you like your job, you just refer to them as "sir" and "ma'am".
cards.text: Gain 15[Credits].
cards.title: Restructure
