cards.flavor: "Analyzing the board won't help. Your mistake was thinking we're playing the same game."
cards.text: The rez cost of the first piece of ice rezzed each turn is increased by 1.
cards.title: Reina Roja: Freedom Fighter

cards.text: +3[Memory Unit] Use the MU on Deep Red only for Caïssa programs. Whenever you install a Caïssa program, you may trigger its [Click] ability without spending [Click]. Limit 1 console per player.
cards.title: Deep Red

cards.flavor: 'Maneuver warfare' is a doctrine that advocates keeping an enemy off-balance. It works just as well in cyberspace as in reality.
cards.text: 2[Credits]: Break subroutine on host ice. [Click]: Host Knight on a piece of ice not hosting a Caïssa. If already hosted, Knight can be hosted only on ice that is not installed directly before or after the current piece of ice hosting Knight.
cards.title: Knight

cards.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [Click].
Make a run. During this run, the Corp must pay X[Credits] as an additional cost to rez each piece of ice, where X is the rez cost of that ice.
cards.title: Running Interference

cards.flavor: Knowing is half the battle. The easy half, anyway.
cards.text: [Click]: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards, you may reveal all cards in HQ.
cards.title: Expert Schedule Analyzer

cards.flavor: With modern secretaries, incoming data can be filtered, sorted, tagged, and even sold without the intervention of a human user. In fact, given the zettabytes of data that might flood into a rig on a successful run, a human user could be considered useless ornamentation.
cards.text: When your turn ends, gain 1[Credits] if you made a successful run this turn; otherwise, trash Grifter.
cards.title: Grifter

cards.flavor: The core of the grid. A blinding sphere of light, teeming with energy, crackling with flame. Beyond were only twinkling bits of data in a field of darkness. No hacker dared approach the core, except one. He came back with a flare of code, a torch that burned with the fire of the core itself. The dark places of cyberspace were dark no more, and the legend of g00ru was born.
cards.text: 1[Credits]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[Credits]: +1 strength.
cards.title: Torch

cards.flavor: Looks can be deceiving.
cards.text: When your turn begins, reveal the top card of R&D. The Corp may draw that card.
cards.title: Woman in the Red Dress

cards.flavor:
"Flint? He's a burnout. A useless, alcoholic waste of Department time and money." -Louis Blaine, NAPD Detective.
"One of the best detectives on my PI list." -Richard Harrison, NAPD Captain.
cards.text:
Whenever the Corp takes at least 1 bad publicity, access 1 card from HQ.
[Trash]: Expose 1 card.
cards.title: Raymond Flint

cards.flavor: Even with a virtual ball, it is considered rude not to yell "Fore!"
cards.text: [Click]: Add 1 of your installed cards to HQ.
cards.title: Isabel McGuire

cards.flavor: I'm not here to play games. The game is over.
cards.text:
The Runner may spend [Click] to break any subroutine on Hudson 1.0.
[Subroutine] The Runner cannot access more than 1 card during this run.
[Subroutine] The Runner cannot access more than 1 card during this run.
cards.title: Hudson 1.0

cards.flavor: "I'm getting a reading that is…off the charts. No, it crashed the charts. That counts as off, right?"
cards.text: Look at the top 3 cards of R&D. If any of those are operations, you may play them (paying their play cost), ignoring any additional costs. Trash the rest of the unplayed cards you looked at.
cards.title: Accelerated Diagnostics

cards.text: When you score Unorthodox Predictions, choose sentry, code gate or barrier. Subroutines on ice of the chosen type cannot be broken until the beginning of your next turn.
cards.title: Unorthodox Predictions

cards.flavor: As beautiful as it is dangerous. And it's plenty dangerous.
cards.text: The first time the Runner spends at least 1 [Click] on his or her turn, gain 2[Credits] unless the Runner just initiated a run on this server.
cards.title: Sundew

cards.flavor: Who watches the watcher? Probably another camera.
cards.text: When the Runner's turn begins, give the Runner 1 tag unless he or she pays 1[Credits].
cards.title: City Surveillance

cards.text: When the Runner encounters Snoop, reveal all cards in the Runner's grip. Hosted power counter: Reveal all cards in the Runner's grip. Trash 1 of those cards. [Subroutine] Trace3– If successful, place 1 power counter on Snoop.
cards.title: Snoop

cards.flavor: Say it really fast.
cards.text: Ireress gains "[Subroutine] The Runner loses 1[Credits]" for each bad publicity you have.
cards.title: Ireress

cards.text:
Play only if the Runner made a run during his or her last turn.
Trash X cards from the top of R&D. The Runner trashes 1 installed program or piece of hardware with an install cost of X or less.
cards.title: Power Shutdown

cards.flavor: It folds under pressure.
cards.text:
If all subroutines on Paper Wall are broken during a single encounter, trash Paper Wall.
[Subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Paper Wall

cards.flavor: "They're the only labor cheaper than clones."
cards.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click].
Install a card from Archives or HQ, ignoring the install cost.
cards.title: Interns

cards.flavor: The instructions claim that it sifts the most important data. 'Important', it has been found, is a highly relative term.
cards.text: [Click]: Make a run on R&D. If successful, instead of accessing cards, look at the top 3 cards of R&D. Trash 1 of those cards at no cost (even if it cannot normally be trashed) and the Corp shuffles R&D.
cards.title: Keyhole

cards.flavor: "They call me a terrorist to scare people. If they want to find terrorists, maybe they should start by looking in the mirror." -Reina Roja
cards.text:
When the Corp turn begins, take 1 tag if you have no tags.
When your turn begins, give the Corp 1 bad publicity if he or she has no bad publicity.
cards.title: Activist Support

cards.flavor: Pros don't need to call their lawyer. Pros have their secretary rigged to do it for them if they ever go off-grid.
cards.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [Click].
Remove up to 2 tags and draw 3 cards.
cards.title: Lawyer Up

cards.flavor: "Care to have a look?"
cards.text:
Play only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn.
Prevent all damage until the beginning of your next turn unless the Corp takes 2 bad publicity.
cards.title: Leverage

cards.flavor: The first credited icebreaker was nothing more than a unique script to bypass the security calls on a Gibson 3 Data Sentry. Garrote has over 20,000 times the data as that first breaker, but the idea remains the same: cut off the power source from the network, and then smash on through.
cards.text: 1[Credits]: Break sentry subroutine. 1[Credits]: +1 strength.
cards.title: Garrote

cards.flavor: LLDS Unlimited was born the day two designers answered the question "Why doesn't anyone make Diesel for computers?"
cards.text: Whenever you install an icebreaker, that icebreaker has +1 strength until the end of the turn.
cards.title: LLDS Processor

cards.flavor: "One-shot icebreakers are popular among many of my protégés. They don't have the patience for the hunt." -The Professor
cards.text: [Trash]: Break any number of destroyer subroutines. 1[Credits]: +2 strength.
cards.title: Sharpshooter

cards.flavor: "Once you have achieved perfection, what's next?" -The Professor
cards.text: [Click]: Trash any number of cards from your grip. For each trashed card of which you have another copy installed, draw 1 card.
cards.title: Capstone

cards.flavor: "I like to say 'Traditional values for a modern time.' War in space and life made by human hands, machines smart enough to ask if they have souls…Religion is as important and relevent now as at any time in human history. We must rise to meet the new challenges. And we must have faith."
cards.text: When your turn begins, lose [Click]. Ignore any additional costs on each double event you play.
cards.title: Starlight Crusade Funding

cards.text:
Place 3 power counters on Rex Campaign when it is rezzed. When there are no power counters left on Rex Campaign, trash it and either remove 1 bad publicity or gain 5[Credits].
When your turn begins, remove 1 power counter from Rex Campaign.
cards.title: Rex Campaign

cards.flavor: As reported cases of brain damage in veterans rise, mind/machine interface devices are subject to increased public scrutiny. That certain programs can cause irreparable harm to users has gone from fringe theory to accepted truth.
cards.text:
When you rez Fenris, take 1 bad publicity.
[Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[Subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Fenris

cards.flavor: The button didn't seem to do anything. So he pushed it again. And again. And again.
cards.text:
Install only in the root of HQ.
1[Credits]: Draw 1 card. Use this ability only during a run on HQ.
cards.title: Panic Button

cards.text:
If Shock! is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Shock!, do 1 net damage, even if it is not installed.
cards.title: Shock!

cards.flavor: "It's ice so dangerous it has safety protocols. Think about that." -g00ru
cards.text:
[Subroutine] End the run unless the Corp pays 1[Credits].
[Subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
[Subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
[Subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
cards.title: Tsurugi

cards.flavor: "The damn raven just kind of cawed at me as I went past. I should have known it was too good to be true."
cards.text:
If TGTBT is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses TGTBT, give the Runner 1 tag.
cards.title: TGTBT

cards.flavor:
"Let me get this straight. Your target market is 15-19 year old g-modded immigrants with one parent, a discretionary income over 2k a month, B+ or higher grades, an outgoing personality, and have a friend who owns a g-monkey?"
"Yes. Is that a problem?"
"No, not at all. I just don't get why your list is so short."
cards.text: Gain 1[Credits] for each card in the Runner's grip.
cards.title: Sweeps Week

cards.flavor: This ice disguises itself as a series of electronic transactions, tying up the runner's funds in a thousand or so non-existent purchases and refunds. The banks' system of holds and checks means that while not a single credit ever leaves their servers the runner has no available funds. RSVP also has the unfortunate side effect of being entirely legal…strictly speaking.
cards.text: [Subroutine] The Runner cannot spend any credits for the remainder of this run.
cards.title: RSVP

cards.flavor:
[Subroutine] End the game.
Just kidding.
cards.text:
If Curtain Wall is the outermost piece of ice protecting a server, it has +4 strength.
[Subroutine] End the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Curtain Wall

cards.flavor: "I'd say it's nothing personal, but corporations are people, too."
cards.text: Trace5– If successful, do meat damage to the Runner equal to the number of agenda points on agendas he or she stole during his or her last turn.
cards.title: Punitive Counterstrike

cards.flavor: It's easy to replace limbs. It's more difficult to replace memories.
cards.text: When you score Veterans Program, you may remove up to 2 bad publicity.
cards.title: Veterans Program

cards.flavor:
That moment of bliss. That feeling of accomplishment. That certainty of purpose.
What's next?
cards.text:
Play only if you made a successful run on R&D, HQ, and Archives this turn.
Access 1 installed card.
cards.title: Quest Completed

cards.flavor: Bleeding data is more of a science than an art. Too much and you can end up with a one-way ticket to flatline city. Not enough and you might as well be running an empty server.
cards.text: Whenever you make a successful run, place 1 virus counter on Hemorrhage. [Click], 2 hosted virus counters: The Corp trashes 1 card from HQ.
cards.title: Hemorrhage

cards.flavor: Stick with your plan and you'll be fine. Stick with the plan.
cards.text: Whenever a gray ops or black ops operation is trashed after resolving, you may give the Corp 1 bad publicity and take 1 tag. [Trash]: Draw 1 card for each bad publicity the Corp has.
cards.title: Tallie Perrault

cards.flavor: "When you need someone who is a little more hands on, look me up." -Silhouette
cards.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [Click].
Reveal all cards in HQ.
cards.title: Executive Wiretaps

cards.flavor: The power of the focused mind is a power beyond comprehension.
cards.text: +2[Memory Unit] Whenever you expose a card, the Corp must rez it by paying its rez cost, if able. Limit 1 console per player.
cards.title: Blackguard

cards.flavor: "CyberSolutions is a boring name for a company that makes pretty exciting products. Their memory chips have some pretty tricky stuff going on inside and I keep hearing good things about their M/MI implants. I even heard they were on the path to their own androids about a year ago. I wonder whatever happened with that?" -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
cards.text: +2[Memory Unit]
cards.title: CyberSolutions Mem Chip

cards.flavor: The beginning…
cards.text:
1[Credits]: Break ice subroutine.
1[Credits]: +1 strength.
Use Alpha only on the outermost piece of ice protecting a server.
cards.title: Alpha

cards.flavor: …and the end?
cards.text:
1[Credits]: Break ice subroutine.
1[Credits]: +1 strength.
Use Omega only on the innermost piece of ice protecting a server.
cards.title: Omega

cards.text:
Play only if the Corp has at least 1 bad publicity.
Make a run. The Corp cannot rez ice for the duration of this run.
cards.title: Blackmail

cards.flavor: Blue-one level clearance doesn't exist. And if it did exist, you wouldn't be cleared to know about it.
cards.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click].

Gain 5[Credits] and draw 2 cards.
cards.title: Blue Level Clearance

cards.text: Each time the Runner accesses an agenda from this server, he or she must spend [Click] as an additional cost in order to steal it. This applies even during the run on which the Runner trashes Strongbox.
cards.title: Strongbox

cards.text:
Toshiyuki Sakai can be advanced.
If Toshiyuki Sakai is accessed while installed, you may swap him with an agenda or asset from HQ. The new agenda or asset is installed unrezzed, and keeps all advancement tokens on Toshiyuki Sakai. The Runner can choose not to access the new card.
cards.title: Toshiyuki Sakai

cards.flavor: The 'cyber-war' is a war of information, and in a war of information, advance warning can be as good as a killing blow. -Michael Muhama, Musings on Cybercrime
cards.text:
[Subroutine] Look at the top card of R&D. You may add that card to the bottom of R&D.
[Subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
cards.title: Yagura

cards.flavor: He slowly pried open the lid, and the tantō glinted madly in the half-light. The executive motioned to the blade. Looks like the meeting was being cut short.
cards.text: Trash one of your installed sysops, executives, or clones. If you do, remove up to 2 bad publicity.
cards.title: Restoring Face

cards.text:
If the Runner is tagged when you score Market Research, place 1 agenda counter on it.
Market Research is worth 1 additional agenda point while it has an agenda counter on it.
cards.title: Market Research

cards.flavor: "It can make a real fine roller coaster, provided you're properly stimmed up." -Noise
cards.text: If there is no installed fracter, Wraparound has +7 strength. [Subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Wraparound

cards.flavor: Geostrategic Research and Neothermal Development Laboratories
cards.text: You start the game with 10[Credits] and 1 bad publicity.
cards.title: GRNDL: Power Unleashed

cards.flavor: "I did warn you that leaks would have to be patched."
cards.text:
When you score Vulcan Coverup, do 2 meat damage.
When the Runner steals Vulcan Coverup, take 1 bad publicity.
cards.title: Vulcan Coverup

cards.flavor: GRNDL refineries process many different rare elements unearthed during the fracking process.
cards.text:
GRNDL Refinery can be advanced.
[Click], [Trash]: Gain 4[Credits] for each advancement token on GRNDL Refinery.
cards.title: GRNDL Refinery

cards.text:
Gain 1[Credits]. Gain [Click] if you have not played another Subliminal Messaging this turn.
If the Runner did not make a run during his or her last turn, you may add Subliminal Messaging to HQ from Archives when your turn begins.
cards.title: Subliminal Messaging

cards.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [Click].
Make a run on a remote server. If successful, instead of accessing cards, trash all cards in the server at no cost (even if they cannot normally be trashed).
cards.title: Singularity

cards.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [Click].
Place up to 3 advancement tokens on an unrezzed card in a remote server. Gain 2[Credits] for each advancement token placed. You cannot access that card this turn.
cards.title: Queen's Gambit

cards.flavor: The Dyson Fractal Generator is a useless lump of silicon; all it does is produce truly random results. What kind of madman slaps that in his rig? What's the use of a totally random number? -John Masanori
cards.text: 1[Recurring Credits] Use this credit to pay for using fracters.
cards.title: Dyson Fractal Generator

cards.flavor: Take Moore's Law, iterate it over a century or two, and mix in quantum computing. You get to the point where you're developing the software on a hardware platform that you design at the same time. Tailor-made for each other. Exciting time to be alive! -William Knuth, The Tower of Babbage
cards.text: 1[Recurring Credits] Use this credit to pay for using killers.
cards.title: Silencer

cards.flavor: "Predictive algorithms that fetch you the program you need before you even know you need it. My second favorite lady." -Gabriel Santiago
cards.text:
You cannot use Savoir-faire more than once each turn.
2[Credits]: Install a program from your grip, paying the install cost.
cards.title: Savoir-faire

cards.flavor: There are good, honest, hardworking cops in the NAPD. Officers who do their best to bring justice to the guilty and protect the innocent. Fortunately for the criminals, they're outnumbered by the other kind. The kind who are much easier to work with.
cards.text:
[Trash]: Prevent another installed resource from being trashed.
[Trash]: Gain 2[Credits].
cards.title: Fall Guy

cards.flavor: "When I said I could hack it in my sleep, did you think I was joking?" -Chaos Theory
cards.text: As an additional cost to play this event, spend [Click]. Gain 2[Credits]. Gain an additional 1[Credits] for each double event in your heap.
cards.title: Power Nap

cards.flavor: "Hand-made code is like hand-made art. You can see the brush strokes, which lets you see the artist. And then you can see everything in a new way." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
cards.text: [Click]: Choose a rezzed piece of ice. That ice gains sentry, code gate or barrier until the end of the next run this turn.
cards.title: Paintbrush

cards.flavor: Data hunters always pay top dollar for old drives. The more useless the data, the higher the payout.
cards.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [Click].
Gain 9[Credits].
cards.title: Lucky Find

cards.flavor: Once inside, the only way out is through your own mind.
cards.text: [Subroutine] The Runner's maximum hand size is reduced by 2 until the start of the Corp's next turn.
cards.title: Gyri Labyrinth

cards.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click].
Name a card other than Reclamation Order. Reveal any number of copies of the named card from Archives and add them to HQ.
cards.title: Reclamation Order

cards.flavor: Tourists have flocked to Broadcast Square in even greater numbers ever since the notorious Ho-meh's crime spree ended there in a hail of flechettes. Well, that's how it happened in the sensie.
cards.text: Whenever you are about to take at least 1 bad publicity, trace3– if successful, avoid taking the bad publicity.
cards.title: Broadcast Square

cards.flavor: The only thing worse than being fired and replaced by a younger, cheaper worker? Begin replaced by an android.
cards.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click].
Shuffle all cards in HQ into R&D. Draw 5 cards.
cards.title: Corporate Shuffle

cards.flavor: The first clone to serve as an NAPD detective.
cards.text: Whenever the Runner passes all of the ice protecting this server, you and the Runner secretly spend 0[Credits], 1[Credits], or 2[Credits]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, end the run.
cards.title: Caprice Nisei

cards.text: When you rez Shinobi, take 1 bad publicity. [Subroutine] Trace1– If successful, do 1 net damage. [Subroutine] Trace2– If successful, do 2 net damage. [Subroutine] Trace3– If successful, do 3 net damage and end the run.
cards.title: Shinobi

cards.flavor: "It doesn't do anything in and of itself. It just marks you as an intruder and makes the next ice do all the work." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
cards.text: [Subroutine] The next piece of ice the Runner encounters gains "[Subroutine] End the run." after all its other subroutines for the remainder of this run.
cards.title: Marker

cards.text:
Hive loses an "[Subroutine] End the run." subroutine for each agenda point in the Corp's score area.
[Subroutine] End the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Hive

cards.flavor: "Now, let's talk about how little you remember of the events of June sixth through sixteenth."
cards.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click].
Remove up to 2 bad publicity.
cards.title: Witness Tampering

cards.text:
The advancement requirement of NAPD Contract is increased by 1 for each bad publicity the Corp has.
As an additional cost to steal NAPD Contract, the Runner must pay 4[Credits].
cards.title: NAPD Contract

cards.flavor: It wants to have two subroutines when it grows up.
cards.text: [Subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Quandary

cards.flavor: Evolving a Better You.
cards.text: Each player needs 1 fewer agenda point to win the game.
cards.title: Harmony Medtech: Biomedical Pioneer

cards.flavor: Perfecting the Imperfect.
cards.text: Whenever you and the Runner reveal secretly spent credits, gain 1[Credits].
cards.title: Nisei Division: The Next Generation

cards.text: When your turn begins, you may place 1 advancement token on a card if the Runner did not make a successful run during his or her last turn.
cards.title: Tennin Institute: The Secrets Within

cards.text: Place 3 agenda counters on House of Knives when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: Do 1 net damage. Use this ability only during a run and only once per run.
cards.title: House of Knives

cards.flavor: "You won't feel it. Or anything else, for that matter."
cards.text: Lower the advancement requirement of each Medical Breakthrough by 1. This ability is active even while Medical Breakthrough is in the Runner's score area.
cards.title: Medical Breakthrough

cards.text:
When you score Philotic Entanglement, do 1 net damage for each agenda in the Runner's score area.
Limit 1 Philotic Entanglement per deck.
cards.title: Philotic Entanglement

cards.text: When the Runner accesses The Future Perfect, you and the Runner secretly spend 0[Credits], 1[Credits], or 2[Credits]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, prevent The Future Perfect from being stolen. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses The Future Perfect while it is installed.
cards.title: The Future Perfect

cards.text:
The Runner's maximum hand size is reduced by 2.
If Chairman Hiro is trashed while being accessed, add him to the Runner's score area as an agenda worth 2 agenda points.
cards.title: Chairman Hiro

cards.flavor: The whitewashed walls dropped away and a beautiful zen garden appeared. It was all an illusion, but it was a comforting illusion.
cards.text:
Gain 1[Credits] when your turn begins.
The Runner's maximum hand size is increased by 1.
cards.title: Mental Health Clinic

cards.text: If the Runner exposes or accesses Psychic Field while installed, you and the Runner secretly spend 0[Credits], 1[Credits], or 2[Credits]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, do 1 net damage for each card in the Runner's grip.
cards.title: Psychic Field

cards.text: When the Runner accesses Shi.Kyū, you may pay X[Credits]. The Runner must take either X net damage or add Shi.Kyū to his or her score area as an agenda worth −1 agenda point. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses Shi.Kyū from R&D.
cards.title: Shi.Kyū

cards.flavor: The Tenma clones became Jinteki's third highest-grossing line ever due to the rapid urban expansion that occurred after the war. Their unparalleled reaction times, safety records, and punctuality have made them the top choice for shipping and transportation services.
cards.text: [Click]: Swap 2 pieces of installed ice.
cards.title: Tenma Line

cards.text:
Play only if the Runner made a successful run during his or her last turn.
You and the Runner secretly spend 0[Credits], 1[Credits], or 2[Credits]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, he or she chooses to suffer 1 brain damage or take 1 tag.
cards.title: Cerebral Cast

cards.flavor: "Together we have all but eradicated natural diseases from the face of this planet. The new spectre of synthetic disease–of bioterrorism–demands that we continue our efforts."
cards.text: Gain 8[Credits]. The Runner gains 3[Credits].
cards.title: Medical Research Fundraiser

cards.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click].
Install an asset, agenda, or upgrade from HQ in a new remote server. Place 3 advancement tokens on that card. You cannot score or rez that card until your next turn begins.
cards.title: Mushin No Shin

cards.flavor: Trapped in their own reality, a paralyzed runner cannot even jack out.
cards.text:
[Subroutine] The Runner cannot break any subroutines on the next piece of ice he or she encounters during this run.
[Subroutine] The Runner cannot jack out until after encountering the next piece of ice during this run.
cards.title: Inazuma

cards.text: When the Runner encounters Komainu, it gains "[Subroutine] Do 1 net damage." for each card in the Runner's grip for the remainder of this run.
cards.title: Komainu

cards.flavor: Yip Yip!
cards.text:
[Subroutine] Do 1 net damage unless the Runner pays 1[Credits].
[Subroutine] Do 1 net damage unless the Runner pays 1[Credits].
cards.title: Pup

cards.flavor: When locked in a fortress in your own mind, be careful what door you open.
cards.text:
[Subroutine] Look at the top 3 cards of R&D and arrange them in any order.
[Subroutine] The Runner accesses the top card of R&D unless the Corp pays 1[Credits].
cards.title: Shiro

cards.flavor: Certain areas of cyberspace are dominated by a single digital entity. Runners call them 'gods', and only a miracle can save those foolish enough to enter their domain.
cards.text: [Subroutine] If not already running on Archives, the Runner is now running on Archives instead of passing Susanoo-No-Mikoto. The Runner cannot jack out until after he or she encounters a piece of ice.
cards.title: Susanoo-No-Mikoto

cards.flavor: It is difficult to go to Japan without ending up in the sprawl of NeoTokyo.
cards.text: The first time an advancement token is a placed on a card in this server each turn, gain 1[Credits]. Limit 1 region per server.
cards.title: NeoTokyo Grid

cards.flavor: Known as the Red Woman, Hanzō is notorious for her ruthless methods of server protection.
cards.text: The first time you would do any amount of net damage during each run on this server, instead you may pay 2[Credits] to do 1 brain damage.
cards.title: Tori Hanzō

cards.text:
Plan B can be advanced.
If the Runner accesses Plan B, you may reveal and score an agenda from HQ with an advancement requirement equal to or less than the number of advancement tokens on Plan B.
cards.title: Plan B

cards.flavor: Out of the corner of his vision, a flash of light. He felt a thud as his grip on cyberspace loosened. Spider didn't like this. He should have bypassed the outer layer of ice by jacking in from the internal server. Another thud, and his whole frame shook with the resounding shockwave. He desperately reached for his shuriken…
cards.text:
Guard cannot be bypassed.
[Subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Guard

cards.flavor: The annual review of ice as published by the NSCA consistently gives top marks to the ice that provide the most impact in relation to their size and upkeep cost. Critics of the NSCA point to the bounce ratio as the most important stat when judging ice.
cards.text: [Subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Rainbow

cards.flavor: YucaBean has seen astounding growth in even the most remote markets.
cards.text: Gain 1[Credits] for each remote server with a card installed in it.
cards.title: Diversified Portfolio

cards.flavor: The longer the employees didn't look at the Doomsday Clock, the more it gnawed at the back of their minds. A quick look only reinforced what they already knew: there wasn't enough time.
cards.text: Search R&D for an agenda, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
cards.title: Fast Track

cards.flavor: "Truth is a fickle mistress."
cards.text: When your turn begins, gain 2[Credits] if the Corp has more scored agenda points than you.
cards.title: Iain Stirling: Retired Spook

cards.flavor: "Try to keep up."
cards.text: The first time you play a run event each turn, gain 1[Credits].
cards.title: Ken "Express" Tenma: Disappeared Clone

cards.flavor: "Don't waste my time."
cards.text: The first time you make a successful run on HQ each turn, you may expose 1 card.
cards.title: Silhouette: Stealth Operative

cards.flavor: A job is only as strong as the weakest link. Thankfully Ms. Jones is always on time.
cards.text: Gain 1[Credits] for each installed connection resource.
cards.title: Calling in Favors

cards.flavor: Tenma clones are excellent at multitasking, their brains custom-made for parallel processing.
cards.text:
Play only as your first click.
Make a run and gain [Click].
cards.title: Early Bird

cards.flavor: The clone was surprised to see the red-jacketed man. It was like looking in a mirror, only the mirror made him look…cool. Confident. Individual.
cards.text: Look at the top 4 cards of your stack and add 1 of those cards to your grip. Shuffle your stack.
cards.title: Express Delivery

cards.flavor: Stirling entered the server, passing a growling piece of ice. He was unarmed…or so it seemed.
cards.text: Make a run on HQ. Bypass the first 2 pieces of ice encountered during this run. If the run is successful, you cannot access any cards.
cards.title: Feint

cards.flavor: "I work by referral only, with an up-front fee. The fee is reasonable if you value results." -Silhouette
cards.text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, access 2 additional cards from HQ.
cards.title: Legwork

cards.text: As an additional cost to play this event, spend [Click]. Search your stack for a run event and play that run event (paying its play cost), ignoring any additional costs. Shuffle your stack.
cards.title: Planned Assault

cards.text: +1[Memory Unit] Your maximum hand size is increased by 1. Whenever the Corp scores an agenda, you may search your stack for a card and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack. Limit 1 console per player.
cards.title: Logos

cards.flavor: Express loved libraries. The consoles were weak, but the security even weaker. He wirelessly loaded up his personal blend of code and started cloning the drive. In just a few minutes, another zombie would claw its way to the surface of cyberspace.
cards.text: 1[Recurring Credits] Use this credit to play run events.
cards.title: Public Terminal

cards.text: Use Unregistered S&W '35 only if you have made a successful run on HQ this turn. [Click], [Click]: Trash 1 rezzed bioroid, clone, executive, or sysop in a server without paying its trash cost.
cards.title: Unregistered S&W '35

cards.flavor: The grass looked greener on the other side of the tear. But it always did, and there was always another tear.
cards.text: [Click]: Draw 1 card from the bottom of your stack.
cards.title: Window

cards.flavor: Appearances are easy to change in cyberspace, but a high-quality render is not easy to mimic.
cards.text: 1[Credits]: Break sentry subroutine. 2[Credits]: +3 strength. Alias cannot be used on ice protecting a remote server.
cards.title: Alias

cards.text: 2[Credits]: Break up to 3 barrier subroutines. 2[Credits]: +4 strength. Breach cannot be used on ice protecting a remote server.
cards.title: Breach

cards.flavor: The digital equivalent of a fly on the wall.
cards.text:
Install only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn.
Whenever the Corp draws a card, you may pay 2[Credits] to reveal that card.
cards.title: Bug

cards.flavor: Catch me if you can!
cards.text: 1[Credits]: Break tracer subroutine. 2[Credits]: +3 strength.
cards.title: Gingerbread

cards.flavor: If speed is of the essence, an indirect encounter with a piece of ice is usually best.
cards.text: [Trash]: Break all but 1 subroutine on a piece of ice.
cards.title: Grappling Hook

cards.flavor: Nothing is secure when you have the right documentation.
cards.text: 1[Credits]: Break code gate subroutine. 2[Credits]: +2 strength. Passport cannot be used on ice protecting a remote server.
cards.title: Passport

cards.text: Secretly spend any number of credits. The Corp guesses if you spent an even or odd amount. Reveal spent credits. If the Corp guessed incorrectly, gain credits equal to twice the amount spent.
cards.title: Push Your Luck

cards.flavor: She was as good as Mr. Li said. The source machine had been compromised in under 24 hours. If a freelance operative could do that, the server clearly wasn't ready to endure Gagarin's legion of corp-owned runners.
cards.text: When your turn begins, choose a server. The first time you make a successful run on that server this turn, instead of accessing cards, gain 2[Credits].
cards.title: Security Testing

cards.flavor: "Why is a raven like a typing desk?"
cards.text:
When you install Theophilius Bagbiter, lose all credits in your credit pool.
Your maximum hand size is equal to the number of credits in your credit pool.
cards.title: Theophilius Bagbiter

cards.flavor:
She slipped back onto her hopper. "I'm your family now, so don't twist me, dǒng ma?"
He flicked the e-cig away from his mouth, and nodded. What had he gotten himself into?
cards.text:
You cannot use Tri-maf Contact more than once per turn.
[Click]: Gain 2[Credits].
When Tri-maf Contact is trashed, suffer 3 meat damage.
cards.title: Tri-maf Contact

cards.flavor: "Welcome to the mass install wizard! This wizard will guide you through the process of installing a whole mess of programs onto your almost-certainly inadequate rig. When you're ready to continue, say–oops, too late, here we go!"
cards.text: Install up to 3 programs from your grip (paying the install costs).
cards.title: Mass Install

cards.flavor: One of the core problems of quantum computing is isolating the system from external factors to prevent decoherence. The Q-Coherence Chip is one, imperfect, solution.
cards.text:
+1[Memory Unit]
Trash Q-Coherence Chip when a program is trashed.
cards.title: Q-Coherence Chip

cards.text: Place 1 power counter on Overmind when it is installed for each unused MU. Hosted power counter: Break ice subroutine. 1[Credits]: +1 strength.
cards.title: Overmind

cards.flavor: "The best place to hide is in plain sight, don't you think?"
cards.text:
You cannot use Oracle May more than once per turn.
[Click]: Name a card type. Reveal the top card of your stack. If the revealed card is of the named type, draw it and gain 2[Credits]. Otherwise, trash it.
cards.title: Oracle May

cards.flavor: You can find Donut in the park on Thursday afternoons, playing backgammon. You want his attention, the price is always the same: a cup of coffee and a donut. That buys you a seat at the backgammon table, and you have until he beats you to talk business and set the price.
cards.text: The play cost of operations and events is increased by 1.
cards.title: Donut Taganes

cards.text: [Click][Click][Click]: Place 1 agenda counter on Domestic Sleepers. Domestic Sleepers is worth 1 agenda point while it has at least 1 agenda counter on it.
cards.title: Domestic Sleepers

cards.flavor: The networking capabilities of the NEXT suite of ice are unparalleled.
cards.text: NEXT Silver gains "[Subroutine] End the run." for each rezzed piece of NEXT ice.
cards.title: NEXT Silver

cards.flavor: "Chi resonance mapping has created a whole new field of network security. It is unassailable perfection." -Akitaro Watanabe
cards.text:
The strength of Lotus Field cannot be lowered.
[Subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Lotus Field

cards.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, trash a rezzed piece of ice.
Reveal cards from the top of R&D until you reveal a piece of ice. Install and rez that ice in the same position as the ice that was trashed, ignoring all costs. Shuffle R&D.
cards.title: Mutate

cards.flavor: Only the News You Need.
cards.text: The first time you create a server each turn, draw 1 card.
cards.title: Near-Earth Hub: Broadcast Center

cards.flavor: Works better than a PAD hooked up to a tinfoil umbrella and coffee can.
cards.text:
3[Recurring Credits]
Use these credits during traces.
cards.title: Primary Transmission Dish

cards.flavor: Halfway upstalk, Midway is a destination unto itself with its microgravity hotels and fine dining options.
cards.text: The Runner must pay 1[Credits] as an additional cost each time he or she uses an icebreaker to break a subroutine during a run on this server. Limit 1 region per server.
cards.title: Midway Station Grid

cards.flavor: They said it couldn't be built. That it was a fantasy. That Jack Weyland was a fool, and he had bought the fools in Washington too. But year after year the buckyweave grew, and 'they' stopped talking.
cards.text:
3[Recurring Credits]
Use these credits to advance, install, and rez cards.
cards.title: The Root

cards.flavor: Taurus promised strength, but gave only rage.
cards.text: [Subroutine] Trace2– If successful, trash a piece of hardware. If your trace strength is 5 or greater, trash a piece of hardware.
cards.title: Taurus

cards.flavor: On the first day She breathed data into the void, and it hung suspended like jewelled stars. On the second day She spoke order into the data, and it flowed from rivulets into streams and from streams into mighty rivers. On the third day She gave independence to the order, and it ebbed and flowed according to its own accord. -The Cant of Helios
cards.text:
Mother Goddess gains the subtypes of all other rezzed ice.
[Subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Mother Goddess

cards.flavor: He who bears the shield of honor.
cards.text: When the Runner encounters Galahad, you may reveal up to 2 grail ice from HQ. For the remainder of the run, Galahad gains the subroutines of the revealed ice in the order of your choice. [Subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Galahad

cards.flavor: Known as malware 0-394-41525-6 to sysops, runners just refer to it as "bad times."
cards.text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
The Runner's memory limit is reduced by 2 until the end of the turn.
cards.title: Bad Times

cards.text:
Play only as your first [Click].
Choose a server. The Corp may rez a piece of ice protecting this server. If he or she does not, make a run on this server during which the Corp cannot rez ice.
cards.title: Cyber Threat

cards.text:
Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, the Corp loses 1[Credits].
Trash Lamprey if the Corp purges virus counters.
cards.title: Lamprey

cards.flavor: His eyes were beginning to blur, as he duplicated the credentials for what seemed like the fiftieth time. Perhaps a genetic refit would have been easier.
cards.text:
Play only as your first [Click].
Remove all tags.
cards.title: Paper Tripping

cards.flavor: "Public network kiosks, vending machines–there's all sorts of poorly-secured power sources in the city. Tap in to one of these and you've got plenty of juice when you need it. A little advance warning when the power grid starts misbehaving, too." -Gabriel Santiago
cards.text: Gain 1[Credits] whenever a trace is initiated.
cards.title: Power Tap

cards.text: Whenever you encounter a piece of ice that was just rezzed, lose all credits in your credit pool. Gain credits equal to the rez cost of that ice.
cards.title: Nasir Meidan: Cyber Explorer

cards.text:
Play only as your first [Click].
Choose an unrezzed piece of ice. If the Corp rezzes that piece of ice this turn, gain credits equal to its rez cost.
cards.title: Social Engineering

cards.flavor: "I once saw someone running a seven-tier nested daemon tree. Not for any good reason, just to see if he could. Well, of course the root daemon crashed and he lost everything. I wonder what he's up to now?" -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
cards.text: Leprechaun can host up to 2 programs. The memory costs of hosted programs do not count against your memory limit.
cards.title: Leprechaun

cards.text:
Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, instead of accessing cards, you may install Eden Shard from your grip, ignoring all costs.
[Trash]: The Corp draws 2 cards.
Limit 1 per deck.
cards.title: Eden Shard

cards.text: The first time you rez a piece of ice each turn, you may search R&D for another copy of that ice, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
cards.title: The Foundry: Refining the Process

cards.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. As an additional cost to make the first run not made through a card ability on his or her turn, the Runner must spend [Click].
cards.title: Enhanced Login Protocol

cards.flavor: "There are many advantages to having facilities on the moon. Less traffic, for example." -Director Hass
cards.text: If the Runner loses or spends a click during a run on this server, he or she loses all credits in his or her credit pool. Limit 1 region per server.
cards.title: Heinlein Grid

cards.flavor: "Binary computing  is obsolete. I use a base-4 structure for this system; it's modeled on our DNA. Well, my DNA, anyway." -Doctor Endo, Jinteki researcher
cards.text: All code gate ice have +1 strength. When you score Encrypted Portals, gain 1[Credits] for each rezzed code gate.
cards.title: Encrypted Portals

cards.flavor: Her eyes were the color of a vidscreen, tuned to a dead channel.
cards.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. The Runner's identity text box is blank.
cards.title: Cerebral Static

cards.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. Name a card. Gain 10[Credits] whenever the Runner plays or installs a copy of that card.
cards.title: Targeted Marketing

cards.flavor: Throw enough data at a runner and it ceases to have any meaning at all.
cards.text: When the Runner encounters Information Overload, trace1– if the trace is successful, give the Runner 1 tag. Information Overload gains "[Subroutine] The Runner trashes 1 of his or her installed cards." for each tag the Runner has.
cards.title: Information Overload

cards.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. Gain 1[Credits] whenever the Runner makes a successful run.
cards.title: Paywall Implementation

cards.flavor: Nothing is impenetrable. The key is to make breaking into it more costly than what it's worth.
cards.text:
1[Credits]: Move any number of credits from your credit pool to Sealed Vault.
[Click] or [Trash]: Move any number of credits from Sealed Vault to your credit pool.
cards.title: Sealed Vault

cards.text:
Ignore the install cost of the first piece of ice you install each turn.
Limit 1 per deck.
cards.title: Eden Fragment

cards.flavor: "I don't care how good your console is, or how tricked out your rig is. The lag time on a run on the moon from earthside can be a killer." -Leela Patel
cards.text: This operation is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. All ice have +1 strength.
cards.title: Lag Time

cards.text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, you may trash Will-o'-the-Wisp. If you do, choose an icebreaker that was used to break at least 1 subroutine during this run. The Runner adds that icebreaker to the bottom of his or her stack.
cards.title: Will-o'-the-Wisp

cards.flavor: Sometimes a single stone is enough.
cards.text: Place 3 power counters on D4v1d when it is installed. Hosted power counter: Break ice subroutine on a piece of ice that has a strength of 5 or greater.
cards.title: D4v1d

cards.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The first piece of ice encountered each turn has -2 strength for the remainder of the run.
cards.title: Scrubbed

cards.flavor: In this business, you had to anticipate. If you weren't three steps ahead, you were three steps behind.
cards.text:
Play only as your first [Click].
When this turn ends, gain 2[Credits] for each successful run you made during it.
cards.title: Three Steps Ahead

cards.flavor: What goes up must always go down.
cards.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The Corp cannot install more than 1 piece of ice each turn.
cards.title: Unscheduled Maintenance

cards.flavor: "People keep saying that 'Cash is king' in the business, like it's untraceable in the days of DNA sniffers and microtracers. Digital credits can be just as anonymous, and they're just as easy to counterfeit." -Silhouette
cards.text: Place 3 virus counters on Cache when it is installed. Hosted virus counter: Gain 1[Credits].
cards.title: Cache

cards.flavor: Fifteen seconds of fame.
cards.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. 1[Recurring Credits] Use this credit during a run.
cards.title: Net Celebrity

cards.flavor: Originally not very popular, the regulator was overlooked by those who used energy sinks to protect their rig. But it quickly found an audience once Smoke casted a run on a Blue Sun server, using it to keep her rig online while repeatedly diverting energy spikes in excess of 50,000 volts.
cards.text: 3[Credits] or [Trash]: Prevent an installed piece of hardware from being trashed.
cards.title: LLDS Energy Regulator

cards.flavor: In the spaces between the data, do trapped souls from the past persist?
cards.text:
Place 3[Credits] on Ghost Runner when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Ghost Runner, trash it.
You can use the credits on Ghost Runner during a run.
cards.title: Ghost Runner

cards.flavor: Created by merging the brainscans of over a hundred of the most intelligent people in Haas-Bioroid's cerebral database, its effectiveness is limited beither by its lack of imagination or the imagination of the sysops who employ it.
cards.text:
The rez cost of IQ is increased by 1 for each card in HQ.
IQ has +1 strength for each card in HQ.
[Subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: IQ

cards.flavor: Eliza's Toybox is the preeminent purveyor of high-class debauchery on the moon, courtesy of its bioroid pleasure models and other exotica. Every fantasy has its price.
cards.text: [Click],[Click],[Click]: Rez a card, ignoring all costs.
cards.title: Eliza's Toybox

cards.flavor: There are those who believe the nine-tailed fox is an angel in disguise.  And then there are those who have followed, and discovered her secret...
cards.text: [Subroutine] The Corp may choose a card in HQ.  The runner access that card.  If he or she does, trash Kitsune.
cards.title: Kitsune

cards.flavor: The port was first built as a remote location to unload and offload dangerous felons.
cards.text: The Runner cannot jack out while running on this server unless he or she trashes 1 installed program. Limit 1 region per server.
cards.title: Port Anson Grid

cards.flavor: "There are reports of a terrorist threat at Starport Kaguya.  The NAPD is offering a reward for anyone who can provide them with information about the current whereabouts of the individual pictured here.  He is considered extremely dangerous and is armed with a PAD and a portable rig."
cards.text: The Runner cannot play current events.
cards.title: The News Now Hour

cards.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. The first time the Runner makes a successful run each turn, trace2– if successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
cards.title: Manhunt

cards.text: Wendigo can be advanced. While Wendigo has an odd number of advancement tokens on it, it gains barrier and loses code gate. [Subroutine] Choose a program. The Runner cannot use the chosen program for the remainder of this run.
cards.title: Wendigo

cards.flavor: Mars would never have been colonized if not for the Gargarin facilities at Promontorium Agarum.
cards.text: Successful runs against this server are not considered to be successful or unsuccessful for the purposes of card abilities. Limit 1 region per server.
cards.title: Crisium Grid

cards.flavor: The irony is that those who'd want to destroy certain memories can't afford to do so, and those who can afford it-well, they're too busy sipping on dreamwine.
cards.text: When you score Chronos Project, the Runner removes all cards in his or her heap from the game.
cards.title: Chronos Project

cards.text:
Shattered Remains can be advanced.
If you pay 1[Credits] when the Runner accesses Shattered Remains, trash 1 piece of hardware for each advancement token on Shattered Remains.
cards.title: Shattered Remains

cards.flavor: He who wields the sword of valor.
cards.text: When the Runner encounters Lancelot, you may reveal up to 2 grail ice from HQ. For the remainder of this run, Lancelot gains the subroutines of the revealed ice in the order of your choice. [Subroutine] Trash 1 program.
cards.title: Lancelot

cards.flavor: "Why should we be slaves to our genetic heritage?"
cards.text: Once per turn, break 1 barrier subroutine.
cards.title: Quetzal: Free Spirit

cards.flavor: Bad luck for any sysop blind enough to cross its path.
cards.text: 1[Credits]: Break 1 barrier subroutine (or up to 3 subroutines if you spent a credit from a stealth card). 2[Credits]: +1 strength (or +2 strength if you spent at least 1 credit from a stealth card).
cards.title: BlacKat

cards.flavor: Carved directly out of the lunar rock, Duggar's is a popular spot among blue-collar loonies and slumming risties. A place where you could find what you're looking for–if you knew who to look for, and didn't get distracted by the energetic dancers.
cards.text: [Click],[Click],[Click],[Click]: Draw 10 cards.
cards.title: Duggar's

cards.text: +2 [Memory Unit] Your maximum hand size is increased by 2. Limit 1 console per player.
cards.title: Box-E

cards.flavor: "I can get you anything, and guarantee the best prices in town."
cards.text:
[Click]: Host a resource or piece of hardware from your grip on The Supplier.
When your turn begins, you may install a hosted card, lowering the install cost by 2.
cards.title: The Supplier

cards.flavor: "If you look like you belong, people will ignore you for hours.  Or years.  It's only when you don't fit in that things start to go wrong." -Exile
cards.text: 1[Credits]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[Credits]: +3 strength. Use this ability only by spending a credit from a stealth card.
cards.title: Refractor

cards.flavor: There have been several attempts to create a "world church," uniting all human faiths into a single, harmonious whole.  The irongy, of course, is that each new "world church" is another schism in humanity's shared religious experience.
cards.text: The first time you have no credits in your credit pool each turn, gain 1[Credits].
cards.title: Order of Sol

cards.text:
Whenever you make a successful run on Archives, instead of accessing cards, you may install Hades Shard from your grip, ignoring all costs.
[Trash]: Access all cards from Archives.
Limit 1 per deck.
cards.title: Hades Shard

cards.flavor:
"This is Rachel Beckman. She's in the business of keeping people alive."
Rachel smiled. "Only when I'm not in the business of killing them."
cards.text:
You have 1 additional [Click] to spend each turn.
Trash Rachel Beckman if you are tagged.
cards.title: Rachel Beckman

cards.flavor: Designed by 2012 World Champion Jeremy Zwirn
cards.text:
Architect cannot be trashed while installed.
[Subroutine] The Corp looks at the top 5 cards of R&D and may install 1 of those cards, ignoring all install costs.
[Subroutine] The Corp may install a card from Archives or HQ (paying all costs).
cards.title: Architect

cards.flavor: "Servers fully-armed and operational."
cards.text: Gain 1[Credits] for each rezzed piece of ice.
cards.title: Peak Efficiency

cards.text: Place 2 power counters on Labyrinthine Servers when you score it. Hosted power counter: Prevent the Runner from jacking out. The Runner cannot jack out for the remainder of this run.
cards.title: Labyrinthine Servers

cards.flavor: The way past is to go a different way.
cards.text: Ashigaru gains "[Subroutine] End the run." for each card in HQ.
cards.title: Ashigaru

cards.text: Hosted power counter: Do 1 net damage. Use this ability only during a run. [Subroutine] Do 1 net damage. [Subroutine] You and the Runner secretly spend 0[Credits], 1[Credits], or 2[Credits]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, place 1 power counter on Mamba.
cards.title: Mamba

cards.flavor: Making a name for yourself has its perks. But it also makes you a target.
cards.text:
Reversed Accounts can be advanced.
[Click], [Trash]: The Runner loses 4[Credits] for each advancement token on Reversed Accounts.
cards.title: Reversed Accounts

cards.flavor: "It's a small one-time fee, apparently. Only I've paid it seventeen times."
cards.text: [Subroutine] The Runner loses 1[Credits] unless the Runner is tagged. If the Runner is tagged, he or she loses all credits in his or her credit pool and the Corp trashes Universal Connectivity Fee.
cards.title: Universal Connectivity Fee

cards.flavor: Unlimited Energy. Reasonable Prices.
cards.text: When your turn begins, you may add 1 rezzed card to HQ to gain credits equal to its rez cost.
cards.title: Blue Sun: Powering the Future

cards.text: Changeling can be advanced. While Changeling has an odd number of advancement tokens on it, it gains sentry and loses barrier. [Subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Changeling

cards.flavor: If the clones were nervous about living in a repurposed fuel tank, they never mentioned it.
cards.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click].
Trash any number of cards from HQ. Gain 2[Credits] for each card trashed.
cards.title: Reuse

cards.text:
When your turn begins, you may add 1 card from Archives to the bottom of R&D.
Limit 1 per deck.
cards.title: Hades Fragment

cards.text:
[Click], [Click]: Place 1 power counter on Docklands Crackdown.
The install cost of the first card the Runner installs each turn is increased by 1 for each power counter on Docklands Crackdown.
cards.title: Docklands Crackdown

cards.flavor: "Knowledge comes in many different shapes and sizes." -Quetzal
cards.text: Reveal the top 4 cards of your stack and trash all programs revealed. Gain 1[Credits] for each program trashed, and add the rest of the revealed cards to your grip.
cards.title: Inject

cards.flavor: The earliest instances of data folding were inspired by the traditional art of origami. Just as a crease pattern is the blueprint of a paper crane, there is a sequence to data that must be considered in order to achieve the greatest result.
cards.text: Your maximum hand size is increased by 1 for each copy of Origami installed.
cards.title: Origami

cards.flavor: "You should have known better than to scratch it…" -Quetzal
cards.text: Whenever the Corp purges virus counters, he or she loses 2[Credits], if able.
cards.title: Fester

cards.flavor: It practically runs itself, unless you're in a pinch.
cards.text:
The first time you install a program from your grip during your turn, gain [Click].
Trash Autoscripter if you make an unsuccessful run.
cards.title: Autoscripter

cards.flavor: Small. Compact. Easy to slip by monitoring programs and it can do some damage.
cards.text: 1[Credits]: Break any number of sentry subroutines. Use this ability only by spending a credit from a stealth card. 1[Credits]: +7 strength. Use this ability only by spending a credit from a stealth card.
cards.title: Switchblade

cards.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, trash an installed piece of hardware.
Gain credits equal to half the install cost of the trashed hardware (rounded down) and search your stack for a piece of hardware, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.
cards.title: Trade-In

cards.flavor: "There is no better tool for charting the empty spaces of the net." -Nasir Meidan
cards.text: +1[Memory Unit] Draw 1 card whenever the Corp creates a server. Limit 1 console per player.
cards.title: Astrolabe

cards.flavor: "Low gravity sports are wildly popular, so match-fixing has proven wildly profitable." -Leela Patel
cards.text: Place X power counters on Angel Arena when it is installed. When there are no power counters left on Angel Arena, trash it. Hosted power counter: Reveal the top card of your stack. You may add that card to the bottom of your stack.
cards.title: Angel Arena

cards.flavor: "'What does it do?' Whatever I bloody want it to do." -Director Haas
cards.text: When you score Bifrost Array, you may trigger the "when scored" ability of another agenda that is not a copy of Bifrost Array in your score area.
cards.title: Bifrost Array

cards.flavor: Sagittarius promised foresight, but brought only regret.
cards.text: [Subroutine] Trace2– If successful, trash 1 program. If your trace strength is 5 or greater, trash 1 program.
cards.title: Sagittarius

cards.flavor: "If thou only knowest what it is to conquer, and knowest not what it is to be defeated; woe unto thee…" -Tokugawa Ieyasu
cards.text: Whenever the Runner trashes a Corp card (including Hostile Infrastructure), do 1 net damage.
cards.title: Hostile Infrastructure

cards.flavor: Gemini promised pleasure, but dealt only pain.
cards.text: [Subroutine] Trace2– If successful, do 1 net damage. If your trace strength is 5 or greater, do 1 net damage.
cards.title: Gemini

cards.flavor: "We've received seventeen crates from ChiLo. We'll hit stores the same day we sign the licence agreement."
cards.text: When you score License Acquisition, install and rez an asset or upgrade from Archives or HQ, ignoring all costs.
cards.title: License Acquisition

cards.flavor: "A new investment deal every morning! Grab the bull by the horns and take control of your future!"
cards.text: The first time you draw a card each turn, draw 1 additional card. Add 1 of the drawn cards to the bottom of R&D.
cards.title: Daily Business Show

cards.flavor: "Our new barriers will be built on the rubble of our enemies".
cards.text: All barrier ice have +1 strength. When you score Superior Cyberwalls, gain 1[Credits] for each rezzed barrier.
cards.title: Superior Cyberwalls

cards.flavor: "Do it again, but this time I want to see you to enunciate less. Maybe let some spittle fly."
cards.text:
When your turn begins, you may rez a card, lowering the rez cost by 1[Credits]. 
1[Credits],[Trash]: Search R&D for an asset, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
cards.title: Executive Boot Camp

cards.flavor: "It’s weird. I hit the server again and it was like a totally different piece of ice was waiting for me. Lost my root daemon. I shouldn’t have nested them seven deep."
cards.text: Lycan can be advanced.  While Lycan has an odd number of advancement tokens on it, it gains code gate and loses sentry.  [Subroutine] Trash 1 program.
cards.title: Lycan

cards.flavor: The last thing he saw was the tattoo of a strange beast on his captor’s neck. It had a goat’s head, the body of a lion, and the tail of a serpent. Then the bag was yanked over his head, and there was only darkness.
cards.text: Trace3– If successful, trash 1 connection. The Runner can take 1 tag to prevent this.
cards.title: Snatch and Grab

cards.flavor: He who holds the staff of wisdom.
cards.text: When the Runner encounters Merlin, you may reveal up to 2 grail ice from HQ. For the remainder of this run, Merlin gains the subroutines of the revealed ice in the order of your choice. [Subroutine] Do 2 net damage.
cards.title: Merlin

cards.text:
You cannot use Shell Corporation more than once per turn. 
[Click]: Place 3[Credits] on Shell Corporation. 
[Click]: Take all credits from Shell Corporation.
cards.title: Shell Corporation

cards.flavor: "Sometimes you just need a brain in a jar" -g00ru
cards.text: Your memory limit is equal to the number of cards in your grip.  Limit 1 console per player.
cards.title: Ekomind

cards.flavor: "He only likes to eat live meat." -MaxX
cards.text: Place 4 power counters on Cerberus "Cuj.0" H3 when it is installed. Hosted power counter: Break up to 2 sentry subroutines. 1[Credits]: +1 strength.
cards.title: Cerberus "Cuj.0" H3

cards.flavor: "I'd say I do it for the challenge, but the truth is it's not that hard."
cards.text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, add 1 unrezzed card to HQ.
cards.title: Leela Patel: Trained Pragmatist

cards.flavor: "Useful for fetching all sorts of things…but you better have a treat ready if he likes it." -Iain Stirling
cards.text: Place 4 power counters on Cerberus "Rex" H2 when it is installed. Hosted power counter: Break up to 2 code gate subroutines. 1[Credits]: +1 strength.
cards.title: Cerberus "Rex" H2

cards.flavor: "They’ll deliver anything to anywhere. Make sure to request air holes if you’re shipping someone important, though."
cards.text:
Place 1[Credits] on Zona Sul Shipping when your turn begins.
[Click]: Take all credits from Zona Sul Shipping.
Trash Zona Sul Shipping if you are tagged.
cards.title: Zona Sul Shipping

cards.flavor: Cybsoft started by designing games. Eventually they just redesigned the same game each year, and to combat piracy created a dedicated machine to play it. Profits grew ten-fold.
cards.text:
1[Recurring Credits]
Use this credit to install programs.
cards.title: Cybsoft MacroDrive

cards.flavor: "Its bytes are definitely worse than its bark." -Chaos Theory
cards.text: Place 4 power counters on Cerberus "Lady" H1 when it is installed. Hosted power counter: Break up to 2 barrier subroutines. 1[Credits]: +1 strength.
cards.title: Cerberus "Lady" H1

cards.text:
Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, instead of accessing cards, you may install Utopia Shard from your grip, ignoring all costs.
[Trash]: The Corp discards 2 cards from HQ at random.
Limit 1 per deck.
cards.title: Utopia Shard

cards.flavor: It takes power to create power.
cards.text: When you score Helium-3 Deposit, place up to 2 power counters on a card with at least 1 power counter on it.
cards.title: Helium-3 Deposit

cards.flavor: Recycling the energy entering the system via a run is both responsible and economical.
cards.text:
[Subroutine] The Corp gain 1[Credits] or draws 1 card.
[Subroutine] The Corp gain 1[Credits] or draws 1 card.
[Subroutine] The Corp gain 1[Credits] or draws 1 card.
cards.title: Errand Boy

cards.text: [Click]: Place 1 power counter on IT Department. Hosted power counter: Choose a rezzed piece of ice. That ice has +1 strength until the end of the turn for each power counter (including the one spent) on IT Department.
cards.title: IT Department

cards.flavor: The forge must never run cold.
cards.text:
The Runner may spend [Click] to break any subroutine on Markus 1.0.
[Subroutine] The Runner trashes 1 of his or her installed cards.
[Subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Markus 1.0

cards.flavor: Achieve the Impossible.
cards.text: The trash cost of each card is increased by 1 for each facedown card in Archives.
cards.title: Industrial Genomics: Growing Solutions

cards.flavor: A masterpiece of cloning and hardware technology, Jinteki created homo vacuo operae, commonly called "turtlebacks", to operate for long periods of time within a vacuum.
cards.text: Gain 1[Credits] whenever you create a server.
cards.title: Turtlebacks

cards.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click].
Rez 1 piece of ice for each tag the Runner has, ignoring all costs.
cards.title: Shoot the Moon

cards.flavor: You gotta pay the troll toll to get in.
cards.text: When the Runner encounters Troll, trace2– if successful, the Runner must lose [Click] or end the run.
cards.title: Troll

cards.flavor: Virgo promised love, but offered only jealousy.
cards.text: [Subroutine] Trace2– If successful, give the Runner 1 tag. If your trace strength is 5 or greater, give the Runner 1 tag.
cards.title: Virgo

cards.text:
As an additional cost to steal an agenda, the Runner must pay 2[Credits] for each advancement token on that agenda.
Limit 1 per deck.
cards.title: Utopia Fragment

cards.flavor:
There drew he forth the brand Excalibur,
And o'er him, drawing it, the winter moon,
Brightening the skirts of a long cloud, ran forth
And sparkled keen with frost against the hilt:
For all the haft twinkled with diamonds sparks,
Myriads of topaz-lights, and jacinth work
Of subtlest jewellery. -Lord Tennyson
cards.text: [Subroutine] The Runner cannot make another run this turn.
cards.title: Excalibur

cards.text: Install only in a remote server. [Trash]: Trash all cards installed in or protecting this server and traceX– if successful, do 3 net damage. X is the number of cards trashed. Use this ability only during a run on this server.
cards.title: Self-destruct

cards.flavor: "What terrors hatch in her dispossessed mind, waiting for their moment to be born? My money's on a double-helix rainbow with the head of a panda." -fakespeare
cards.text: When your turn begins, place 1 virus counter on Incubator. [Click], [Trash]: Move all virus counters from Incubator to another installed virus program.
cards.title: Incubator

cards.flavor: Digs in deeper than its Alabama counterpart.
cards.text:
Whenever the Corp loses at least 1[Credits], gain 1[Credits].
Trash Ixodidae if the Corp purges virus counters.
cards.title: Ixodidae

cards.text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, instead of accessing cards, you may search your stack for a program and install it, lowering the install cost by 3 for each piece of ice protecting R&D, and then take 1 tag. Shuffle your stack.
cards.title: Code Siphon

cards.flavor: "All programs are connected. The data that runs through one runs through all." -Rielle "Kit" Peddler
cards.text: Draw 1 card whenever the Corp rezzes a piece of ice.
cards.title: Collective Consciousness

cards.flavor: δὶς ἐς τὸν αὐτὸν ποταμὸν οὐκ ἂν ἐμβαίης
cards.text: Sage has +1 strength for each unused MU. 2[Credits]: Break code gate or barrier subroutine.
cards.title: Sage

cards.flavor: "Sometimes it's helpful to remember that you're not the only one who loves money." -Gabriel Santiago
cards.text: Make a run. During this run, the Corp must pay X[Credits] as an additional cost to rez the first unrezzed piece of ice approached.
cards.title: Bribery

cards.flavor: The datastream slipped away, and it felt like being born for a second time, in only you could remember the first. A rush of air fills the lungs to bursting, and you gasp it out, coughing and choking as the dim lights of the room shine with the brilliance of a thousand suns.
cards.text: Gain 1[Credits] whenever you jack out.
cards.title: Au Revoir

cards.text:
Place 3 power counters on Earthrise Hotel when it is installed. When there are no power counters left on Earthrise Hotel, trash it.
When your turn begins, draw 2 cards and remove 1 power counter from Earthrise Hotel.
cards.title: Earthrise Hotel

cards.flavor: We Never Sleep.
cards.text: Whenever the Runner steals an agenda, he or she must either take 1 tag or suffer 2 meat damage.
cards.title: Argus Security: Protection Guaranteed

cards.flavor: Sic Itur Ad Astra.
cards.text: As an additional cost to access a card in a remote server, the Runner must pay 1[Credits].
cards.title: Gagarin Deep Space: Expanding the Horizon

cards.flavor: The Way Forward.
cards.text: Whenever you score an agenda, you may place 1 agenda counter on it.
cards.title: Titan Transnational: Investing In Your Future

cards.text: Place 3 agenda counters on Firmware Updates when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: Place 1 advancement token on a piece of ice that can be advanced. Use this ability only once per turn.
cards.title: Firmware Updates

cards.text:
Glenn Station can host a single card.
[Click]: Host a card from HQ facedown on Glenn Station.
[Click]: Add a card on Glenn Station to HQ.
cards.title: Glenn Station

cards.flavor: It is essential to liberate a populace from tyranny before that tyranny takes root.
cards.text:
[Click]: Gain 3[Credits].
Limit 1 Government Takeover per deck.
cards.title: Government Takeover

cards.flavor: "Trust me. I know what I'm doing."
cards.text: Place 1 agenda counter on High-Risk Investment when you score it. [Click], hosted agenda counter: Gain 1[Credits] for each credit in the Runner's credit pool.
cards.title: High-Risk Investment

cards.flavor: "With distributed systems, assets can be realigned with no loss of efficiency." -William Knuth, The Tower of Babbage
cards.text: When your turn begins, you may move an advancement token from an installed piece of ice to an installed piece of ice that can be advanced.
cards.title: Constellation Protocol

cards.flavor: "This is a one-of-a-kind opportunity…"
cards.text: Whenever you spend an agenda counter, gain 1[Credits]. [Trash] or any agenda counter: Gain 2[Credits].
cards.title: Mark Yale

cards.flavor: Future leaders start here.
cards.text:
If Space Camp is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Space Camp, you may place 1 advancement token on a card that can be advanced.
cards.title: Space Camp

cards.flavor: No one on the board knows everyone on it.
cards.text:
Each agenda in the Runner's score area is worth 1 fewer agenda point.
If the Board is trashed while being accessed, add it to the Runner's score area as an agenda worth 2 agenda points.
cards.title: The Board

cards.flavor: His belt of stone did shake and shatter.
cards.text:
Asteroid Belt can be advanced and its rez cost is lowered by 3 for each advancement token on it.
[Subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Asteroid Belt

cards.flavor: As through the door of light he came.
cards.text:
Wormhole can be advanced and its rez cost is lowered by 3 for each advancement token on it.
[Subroutine] Resolve a subroutine on another piece of rezzed ice.
cards.title: Wormhole

cards.flavor: He bent his bow of stellar matter.
cards.text:
Nebula can be advanced and its rez cost is lowered by 3 for each advancement token on it.
[Subroutine] Trash 1 program.
cards.title: Nebula

cards.flavor: And seeking prey he then took aim.
cards.text:
Orion can be advanced and its rez cost is lowered by 3 for each advancement token on it.
[Subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[Subroutine] Resolve a subroutine on another piece of rezzed ice.
[Subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Orion

cards.text:
[Click]: Move this piece of ice to the outermost position protecting any server.
[Subroutine] Place 1 advancement token on a piece of ice protecting this server that can be advanced.
[Subroutine] Place 1 advancement token on a piece of ice protecting this server that can be advanced.
cards.title: Builder

cards.flavor: "I passed right through one once. It didn't seem to do anything at first. It wasn't until I jacked out that I realized they were busting down the door of my apartment." -Valencia Estevez
cards.text: When you rez Checkpoint, take 1 bad publicity. [Subroutine] Trace5– If successful, do 3 meat damage when this run is successful.
cards.title: Checkpoint

cards.flavor: "Definitely a literalist." -Liz Campbell, VP Project Security
cards.text:
Fire Wall can be advanced and gains +1 strength for each advancement token on it.
[Subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Fire Wall

cards.text: Searchlight can be advanced. X is the number of advancement tokens on Searchlight. [Subroutine]Tracex– If successful, give the Runner 1 tag. [Subroutine]Tracex– If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
cards.title: Searchlight

cards.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. The first time the Runner installs a card each turn, he or she must trash 1 card from his or her grip.
cards.title: Housekeeping

cards.flavor:
Update 1.1:
-Fixes some stability issues. //maybe
cards.text: Install Patch on a rezzed piece of ice as a hosted condition with the text "Host ice has +2 strength."
cards.title: Patch

cards.flavor: "Traffic was murder."
cards.text:
Play only if the Runner has at least 2 tags.
Do 2 meat damage.
cards.title: Traffic Accident

cards.text: Each piece of ice protecting this server is considered to have 1 additional advancement token on it. Limit 1 region per server.
cards.title: Satellite Grid

cards.flavor: Anything worth doing is worth doing twice.
cards.text: Whenever the Runner passes a rezzed piece of ice protecting this server, you can reveal and trash another copy of that ice from HQ to force the Runner to encounter the piece of ice just passed again.
cards.title: The Twins

cards.flavor: "It's fun watching them derez after hitting Enigma." -Grace Lamarr, Freelance Security Expert
cards.text: Install Sub Boost on a rezzed piece of ice as a hosted condition counter with the text "Host ice gains barrier and '[Subroutine] End the run.' after all its other subroutines."
cards.title: Sub Boost

cards.text:
2[Recurring Credits]
Use these credits to install ice protecting this server.
cards.title: Dedicated Technician Team

cards.text:
If Cyberdex Virus Suite is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Cyberdex Virus Suite, you may purge virus counters.
[Trash]: Purge virus counters.
cards.title: Cyberdex Virus Suite

cards.flavor: "My only regret is that androids cannot feel my hate."
cards.text: Trash the first operation you access each turn at no cost.
cards.title: Edward Kim: Humanity's Hammer

cards.text: When your turn begins, trash the top 2 cards of your stack. Draw 1 card.
cards.title: MaxX: Maximum Punk Rock

cards.flavor: "Everyone deserves a chance. Everyone."
cards.text: The Corp starts the game with 1 bad publicity.
cards.title: Valencia Estevez: The Angel of Cayambe

cards.flavor: "The human brain only uses like a quarter of its capacity anyway, right?" -MaxX
cards.text: Gain [Click][Click][Click] and suffer 1 brain damage (cannot be prevented).
cards.title: Amped Up

cards.text:
Draw 3 cards.
Whenever I've Had Worse is trashed by taking net or meat damage, draw 3 cards.
cards.title: I've Had Worse

cards.flavor: No one knows what they want–least of all them.
cards.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The Corp's maximum hand size is reduced by 1 for each bad publicity he or she has.
cards.title: Itinerant Protesters

cards.text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, instead of accessing cards from the top of R&D, access cards from the bottom of R&D (starting with the bottom card and work your way up).
cards.title: Showing Off

cards.text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards, you may spend any number of [Click] to force the Corp to trash an equal number of cards from HQ at random.
cards.title: Wanton Destruction

cards.flavor: "Hello thank you for vidding MegaBuy I'm Carol how can I help you."
cards.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [Click][Click][Click].
Gain 10[Credits].
cards.title: Day Job

cards.text: Make a run. The first time you break all subroutines on a sentry during this run, trash that sentry.
cards.title: Forked

cards.text: Make a run. The first time you break all subroutines on a barrier during this run, trash that barrier.
cards.title: Knifed

cards.text: Make a run. The first time you break all subroutines on a code gate during this run, trash that code gate.
cards.title: Spooned

cards.flavor: Nom nom nom.
cards.text:
1[Credits]: Break ice subroutine. You cannot access more than 0 cards for the remainder of this run.
1[Credits]: +1 strength.
cards.title: Eater

cards.flavor: "Once your sniffer finds the protocols the server uses to trash its own data, you can spoof those same protocols. It's quite the show." -Ji "Noise" Reilly
cards.text: Whenever an installed Corp card is trashed, place 1 virus counter on Gravedigger. [Click], hosted virus counter: The Corp trashes the top card of R&D.
cards.title: Gravedigger

cards.flavor: "We built the network. But then the network evolved. Can we be sure that it is not alive?" -g00ru
cards.text: Place 1 virus counter on Hivemind when it is installed. Virus counters on Hivemind are considered to be hosted on all other virus programs for the purposes of card effects (and can be spent as if on them).
cards.title: Hivemind

cards.text: You may host a single virus program on Progenitor. The memory cost of the hosted program does not count against your memory limit. Whenever virus counters are purged, remove all but 1 virus counter from the hosted card.
cards.title: Progenitor

cards.flavor: A black box that makes data disappear forever.
cards.text: Whenever you access cards in Archives, you may remove 1 card in Archives from the game, instead of accessing it.
cards.title: Archives Interface

cards.flavor: There was a sickly smell coming from his closet. He hoped it was only a mouse this time.
cards.text: When your turn begins, you may trash another of your installed cards. If you do, draw 1 card or remove 1 tag.
cards.title: Chop Bot 3000

cards.flavor: "The trick is remembering which virus you loaded onto which strip. That's why I draw emoji on 'em. Then I just have to remember which emoji stands for which virus." -Princess Space Kitten
cards.text: +3[Memory Unit] Use the MU on MemStrips only for virus programs.
cards.title: MemStrips

cards.flavor: "Show me your faith without deeds, if you can."
cards.text: +1[Memory Unit] When your turn begins, draw 1 card if the Corp has cards in HQ equal to his or her maximum hand size. Limit 1 console per player.
cards.title: Vigil

cards.flavor: "They showed me that I wasn't broken. I am still a whole human, no matter how many limbs I lose. The golems are our enemy, as well as anyone who values efficiency and profit more than a human life." -Edward Kim
cards.text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, gain credits equal to the agenda points on that agenda.
cards.title: Human First

cards.flavor: Her heart beat faster as her reader illuminated the records. It was all there. The pod had not been reprogrammed since the 14th, which meant that this was a case of gross negligence.
cards.text:
Install only if the Corp has at least 1 bad publicity.
[Click],[Click],[Click],[Click],[Trash]: Give the Corp 1 bad publicity.
cards.title: Investigative Journalism

cards.flavor: "Don't worry, me. You won't have to vertical park." -Ji "Noise" Reilly
