cards.text: [Trash]: Prevent all damage. Trash all installed hardware, all installed non-virtual resources, and all cards in your grip. Lose all credits in your credit pool. Remove all tags.
cards.title: Sacrificial Clone

cards.flavor: Her eyes were the color of dreams and disasters.
cards.text: When your turn begins, if there are 2 or more power counters on Stim Dealer, remove all power counters from it and suffer 1 brain damage (cannot be prevented); otherwise, place 1 power counter on Stim Dealer and gain [Click].
cards.title: Stim Dealer

cards.flavor: Scraps of code drifting around the network can congeal into pools of data. Within this primordial soup the code breaks, re-assemble, mutates. Evolves.
cards.text:
When your turn begins, place 1 virus counter on Virus Breeding Ground.
[Click]: Move 1 virus counter on Virus Breeding Ground to another card with at least 1 virus counter on it.
cards.title: Virus Breeding Ground

cards.flavor: Runner software is notoriously scratch-built and under-tested, and the shadow net has no tech support. It works, mostly, but sometimes a fresh install is just the ticket.
cards.text: Add an installed program or piece of hardware to your grip.
cards.title: Uninstall

cards.text: When your turn begins, you may lose [Click]. If you do, avoid the first tag you would take until the start of your next turn.
cards.title: Qianju PT

cards.flavor: "Sometimes I like to make origami cranes out of old newsrag. It helps me think, putting it back on the subconscious. I figure it's the same principle for my rig – keep it busy and it makes me a few creds for my trouble." -Quetzal
cards.text: When your turn begins, gain 1[Credits] if you have 2 or more unused MU.
cards.title: Data Folding

cards.text:
The Corp cannot score an agenda on the same turn he or she installed it.
Trash Clot if the Corp purges virus counters.
cards.title: Clot

cards.flavor: "The Valley is littered with good ideas. You need the discipline to execute if you want to stay in my incubator."
cards.text: The first time you install a card each turn (including Paige Piper), you may search your stack for any number of copies of that card and add them to your heap. Shuffle your stack.
cards.title: Paige Piper

cards.flavor: Turns a night owl into an early bird!
cards.text: The first time you lose [Click] each turn, gain [Click].
cards.title: Adjusted Chronotype

cards.text: If you have at least 2[Link], the memory cost of Spike is 0, even if it is not installed. Spike has +1 strength for each installed icebreaker. [Trash]: Break up to 3 barrier subroutines.
cards.title: Spike

cards.text: The first time you make a successful run each turn, the Corp reveals 1 card at random from HQ.
cards.title: Enhanced Vision

cards.text: Genetics also trigger the second time each turn their trigger condition is met.
cards.title: Gene Conditioning Shoppe

cards.flavor: Your heart deserves the best.
cards.text: The first time you take damage each turn, draw 1 card.
cards.title: Synthetic Blood

cards.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The advancement requirement of each agenda is increased by 1 for each copy of that agenda in the Corp's score area.
cards.title: Traffic Jam

cards.flavor: Born for success!
cards.text: The first time you spend [Click] to draw 1 card (not through a card ability) each turn, gain 1[Credits].
cards.title: Symmetrical Visage

cards.flavor: In the vast universe of memories, consciousness slumbers...
cards.text: The rez cost of bioroid ice is lowered by 1 for each unspent click the Runner has.
cards.title: Brain-Taping Warehouse

cards.flavor: "God in Heinlein. What's next, NEXT Platinum?" -John Masanori
cards.text: X is the number of rezzed NEXT ice. [Subroutine] Do X net damage. [Subroutine] Trash X programs.
cards.title: NEXT Gold

cards.text:
Before taking your first turn, you may swap this card with any copy of Jinteki Biotech.
[Click],[Click],[Click]: Flip this identity.
The Brewery: When you flip this identity, do 2 net damage.
The Tank: When you flip this identity, shuffle Archives into R&D.
The Greenhouse: When you flip this identity, place 4 advancement tokens on a card that can be advanced.
cards.title: Jinteki Biotech: Life Imagined

cards.text: When you score Genetic Resequencing, you may place 1 agenda counter on an agenda in your score area.
cards.title: Genetic Resequencing

cards.flavor: The more power a spike process can use, the harder it can hit. The really clever ones borrow the runner's own memory to iterate locally.
cards.text: [Subroutine] Do 1 net damage for each unused MU the Runner has.
cards.title: Cortex Lock

cards.text: Whenever the Runner breaks all subroutines on a piece of ice protecting this server, his or her maximum hand size is reduced by 1 until the beginning of your next turn. Limit 1 region per server.
cards.title: Valley Grid

cards.flavor: "It tracks you and logs you. If you get in you can just delete the log. But first you have to get in." -Gabriel Santiago
cards.text: [Subroutine] Give the Runner 1 tag. If this run is successful, the Runner removes 1 tag.
cards.title: Bandwidth

cards.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. As an additional cost to steal an agenda, the Runner must pay 2[Credits].
cards.title: Predictive Algorithm

cards.flavor: Give a man money, and he is rich for a day. Teach a man how to invest, and he is rich for life.
cards.text: [Click]: Gain 2[Credits].
cards.title: Capital Investors

cards.flavor: "Negotiation is an art, so never negotiate when you can intimidate instead." -Thiago Reyes, VP Strategic Operations
cards.text:
The Runner can pay 2[Credits] to break any subroutine on Negotiator.
[Subroutine] The Corp gains 2[Credits].
[Subroutine] Trash 1 program.
cards.title: Negotiator

cards.flavor: "Don't worry. If this one fails, we can start a new one tomorrow."
cards.text: When your turn begins, you may trash Tech Startup. If you do, search R&D for an asset, reveal it, and install it. Shuffle R&D.
cards.title: Tech Startup

cards.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. As an additional cost to rez non-ice cards, the Corp must randomly trash a card from HQ.
cards.title: Hacktivist Meeting

cards.flavor: Usually crashing with friends means sleeping on the couch. This time, it meant sleeping on a server farm.
cards.text: Off-Campus Apartment can host any number of connections. Whenever you install a connection on Off-Campus Apartment, draw 1 card.
cards.title: Off-Campus Apartment

cards.flavor: "You can help Jinteki shape the future. Your future."
cards.text: Install a resource from your grip, lowering the install cost by 3.
cards.title: Career Fair

cards.text: Place 4 power counters on Dorm Computer when you install it. [Click], hosted power counter: Make a run. Avoid all tags for the remainder of the run.
cards.title: Dorm Computer

cards.text: The first time you install a card each turn, you may install another card of the same type from your grip (paying its install cost).
cards.title: Hayley Kaplan: Universal Scholar

cards.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [Click].
If you have fewer cards in your grip than your maximum hand size, draw cards until you have cards in your grip equal to your maximum hand size.
cards.title: Game Day

cards.text: +1[Memory Unit] The first time you play an event each turn, you may play another event (without spending a click) after the first one resolves. Limit 1 console per player.
cards.title: Comet

cards.flavor: "Once you download the lecture source files, this program does a statistical analysis and distills the most important concepts." -Hayley Kaplan
cards.text: Study Guide has +1 strength for each power counter on it. 1[Credits]: Break code gate subroutine. 2[Credits]: Place 1 power counter on Study Guide.
cards.title: Study Guide

cards.text: Trash all programs hosted on London Library when your turn ends. [Click]: Install a non-virus program from your grip on London Library, ignoring the install cost. [Click]: Add a program on London Library to your grip.
cards.title: London Library

cards.flavor: "There are whole generations of people who never move out of a megalopolis center. You should see the look on their face the first time they see the stars." -Professor Darren Fin, Astronomy
cards.text: [Click], [Click]: Search your stack for a piece of hardware, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.
cards.title: Tyson Observatory

cards.flavor: "So much to do. So little time."
cards.text:
When your turn begins, lose [Click].
Your maximum hand size is increased by 5.
cards.title: Beach Party

cards.flavor: "My research could make your corporation billions. And save lives, of course."
cards.text: When you score Research Grant, you may score another copy of Research Grant that is installed.
cards.title: Research Grant

cards.flavor: Alan Turing laid the foundation for artificial intelligence by suggesting that you could teach a computer to be human.
cards.text: Turing has +3 strength while protecting a remote server. The Runner cannot use AI programs to break subroutines on Turing. [Subroutine] End the run unless the Runner spends [Click][Click][Click].
cards.title: Turing

cards.flavor: Crick and his colleagues ushered in modern genetics by mapping the structure of DNA.
cards.text:
Crick has +3 strength while protecting Archives.
[Subroutine] Install a card from Archives (paying its install cost).
cards.title: Crick

cards.flavor: "My script can perform the Kobayashi algorithm in .12 seconds."
cards.text: Search R&D for up to X different sysops (by title), reveal them, and add them to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
cards.title: Recruiting Trip

cards.flavor: Officially, there is no blacklist. That would be illegal. Unofficially, there is a list, and being on it can ruin a career.
cards.text: Cards cannot leave the Runner's heap for any reason.
cards.title: Blacklist

cards.flavor: Johannes Gutenberg ignited the first Information Revolution by inventing the movable-type printing press.
cards.text: Gutenberg has +3 strength while protecting R&D. [Subroutine] Trace7– If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
cards.title: Gutenberg

cards.flavor: The cost of an education is sometimes felt sharpest in the stomach.
cards.text: As an additional cost to play an event that there is a copy of in his or her heap, the Runner must pay 2[Credits].
cards.title: Student Loans

cards.flavor: Meru Mati pushed the limits of physics by engineering the first buckyweave structure, a thousand-foot long wall.
cards.text:
Meru Mati has +3 strength while protecting HQ.
[Subroutine] End the run.
cards.title: Meru Mati

cards.flavor: After the Big One, real estate value changed sharply. Some found that they had become owners of beachfront property. Others were underwater.

cards.text: Prevent all meat damage and brain damage from installing cybernetics.

Quicksand has +1 strength for each power counter on it.

cards.flavor: The server was quiet that night. I closed my eyes, the low-hum of the datastream lulling me into a trance. When I opened them, the construct stood before me in the shape of a man, clad in light of many colors. His stature was impressive, and his saccharine voice wormed its way into my very soul.
cards.text: Trash a card from your grip: Break ice subroutine. Trash a card from your grip: +2 strength.
cards.title: Faust

cards.flavor: "Whaddya buyin'?"
cards.text:
When you install Street Peddler, host the top 3 cards of your stack facedown on Street Peddler (you may look at these cards at any time).
[Trash]: Install 1 card hosted on Street Peddler, lowering its install cost by 1.
cards.title: Street Peddler

cards.flavor: "Everything has a price."
cards.text: Whenever you use a [Trash] ability, draw 1 card.

As an additional cost to play this event, spend [Click].
Expose 1 card installed in a remote server. Trash that card at no cost if it is an asset or upgrade.

"Isn't this wrong?"
